rec8AioeQ30xZCfwl.Name: intake half
rec8AioeQ30xZCfwl.Bottom Body:
You're halfway through!

Awesome work so far! Just a little more to go and you're all done.

rec8HzxcU5UNKzAec.Name: Quickwin 8.3
rec8HzxcU5UNKzAec.Bottom Body:
**How to do Box Breathing**

Simply sit or lay down somewhere comfortable and do the following:

1. **Inhale**: Slowly inhale through your nose for the count of 4. Notice your belly pushing out as your lungs fill up with air.
2. **Hold your breath**: Hold your breath for another count of 4.
3. **Exhale**: Slowly exhale through your mouth for a count of 4.
4. **Hold your breath**: Once your lungs are empty, hold your breath again for another count of, you guessed it, 4!

4x4x4x4 just like a box! This should make it super easy for you to remember. 

And since 4 is the magic number here, we are going to recommend you repeat it 4 times to get started. As you get better you can do it for longer!

rec8NJQBOBe9ZZSHb.Name: Intro 0.1
rec8NJQBOBe9ZZSHb.Bottom Body:
Everyone knows sleep is important, but do you know _how_ important sleep is to your overall health?

**Sleep is your fountain of youth**. 

It is your **source of health and healing.**

Learning how to reboot your relationship with sleep will absolutely **change your life**. We want to show you how.

Want to hear a shocking fact?

rec8YKxxV6gba4FOe.Name: Bedroom 1.4
rec8YKxxV6gba4FOe.Bottom Body:
**Sleep masks!**

On it’s own or in addition to blackout curtains, a sleep mask can ensure you are eliminating any and alllllll light pollution. 

Choose silk as it’s the nicest on your skin, and some people even claim it helps prevent wrinkles! (Rested Health - solving your sleep problems and your aging problems at the same time)

Sleep masks are also very helpful in blocking pesky lighting from LED lights. They’re everywhere! Extension cords, alarm clocks, air conditioners, humidifiers, and electronics. 

Speaking of electronics...

rec8Zas5xHBbIqHsH.Name: change 1.1
rec8Zas5xHBbIqHsH.Bottom Body:
As you continue through your journeys, climbing the competence ladder and making new goals, you may find yourself asking:

**Is change possible?**

Everyone knows what it's like to set goals and to fall short. 

We want to see you succeed in reaching your sleep goals, so let's take a look at some of the most common roadblocks that people face when trying to make changes (and how to overcome them)...

rec8fL6AHksy7fWmE.Name: CheckIn 1.1
rec8fL6AHksy7fWmE.Bottom Body:
We want to make sure our product is meeting your expectations.

We'd love it if you could help us by answering this SUPER brief question!

rec8w1daiba9in4T6.Name: BedtimeBasics 1.5
rec8w1daiba9in4T6.Bottom Body:
Some extra tips to think about when spending time in the sheets:

1. Make sure to **clean your sheets on a weekly basis** to keep your bed inviting. You deserve it.
2. **Buy new bedding every 18 to 24 months** or, if you’re on a budget, simply replace pillow cases. You can find nice silk or satin pillowcases on any budget. 
3. **Beware of allergies**: Many issues with sheets are due to allergic reactions to detergents. If you have sensitive skin or allergies always wash your bedding in detergent that’s free of dye and perfumes. 

That’s all the time we have to spend in the sheets, but we do have one more **reeeeally** important basic tip to turn your bedroom into a sleep sanctuary…

rec8zZXxkDKVVdTNx.Name: Circadian 1.5
rec8zZXxkDKVVdTNx.Bottom Body:
**Temperature**

Temperature is another important environmental cue for your sleep-wake cycle. Your body temperature fluctuates throughout the day to sync with your sleep-wake cycle. 

For example, it rises toward the morning as your body produces wakefulness-boosting cortisol. Your temperature then drops at night, as your body releases melatonin for sleep. 

Sleeping in a cool room at night is a way to improve your sleep because it works with your body’s natural preferences! Similarly, getting too warm before bed or sleeping in a hot room can disrupt your circadian rhythm.

rec9Kxyk3XuY5IFpo.Name: Foundations 1.1
rec9Kxyk3XuY5IFpo.Bottom Body:
**Get your foundation on**
Change takes time. One of the most common mistakes people make when adopting new habits is changing too much at once. The key to long-term effective change is **building a strong foundation**. 

Building a strong foundation takes time, consistency, and a little resiliency. 

Taking the time to build a strong foundation of sleep habits will serve you for the rest of your life!

rec9PQ9XMWX6DkprD.Name: Why Rested 1.3
rec9PQ9XMWX6DkprD.Bottom Body:
**Imagine this...**
- You wake up 10 minutes before your alarm clock feeling Rested
- Your productivity soars
- You feel calm and in control
- Sleep is your superpower 

It's possible. If you dedicate yourself to our program, you **_will_** get results. 

Let's explore how...

rec9e0wjV9Xiiak6j.Name: Orientation 2.6
rec9e0wjV9Xiiak6j.Bottom Body:
Are you stoked and ready to begin your next week of Reboot Camp?

Let’s go!

rec9f6KtfvBrvyNQD.Name: Wokeuptired 1.1
rec9f6KtfvBrvyNQD.Bottom Body:
Have you ever had one of those mornings where you wake up tired even though it felt like you slept ok?

You see, the relationship between “I got enough sleep” and “I’m feeling Rested” is not always straightforward. 

There are several reasons why you might wake up not feeling refreshed (and there are some things you can do about it). 

This part of the Reboot Camp journey is going to help you identify some reasons why you might be waking up tired.

rec9i4WnWJeSbv4ct.Name: Mornings 1.3
rec9i4WnWJeSbv4ct.Bottom Body:
Building a morning ritual may seem overwhelming at first glance, but as you begin to implement it you’ll find that it has many rewards. Plus, there’s no need to overachieve and complicate things.

It takes some trial and error to find what works for you. We’ll teach you how to really elevate your morning routine later. For now, it’s important to get the basics down and always include something you look forward to doing. 

Let’s get started on the foundations of a good morning ritual...

rec9nJq3ePAcJ8QQo.Name: goalfallasleepfaster1.2
rec9nJq3ePAcJ8QQo.Bottom Body:
**1. Wake up at the same time every morning**

You'll come across this tip again and again. Sleep gets complicated by a lot of factors and one of them is an inconsistent schedule. 

By waking up at the same time every morning, you are giving your body a chance to regulate its natural rhythms. Plus, setting your wake-up time is way easier than setting your sleep time. 

**Why does it help?** Many of your body's processes are driven by internal clocks. When these mechanisms get misaligned it leads to many issues, including sleep problems. A consistent wake-up time helps to reset your body's internal clock.

It's a game-changer for many sleep problems!

Now, let's look at the next tip...

rec9nhuZz1tAvgyXZ.Name: QuickwinFA 12.4
rec9nhuZz1tAvgyXZ.Bottom Body:
There you have it, an all natural way to snack and boost that wonderful hormone melatonin! 

As a bonus, many of these foods also contain natural nutrients and vitamins like B12 that help regulate your sleep-wake cycle. 

Eating for better sleep is not something people talk about a lot, but it’s a very real thing you can do!

So, why not grab yourself a bowl of oatmeal topped with tart cherries and almonds and boost that melatonin!

rec9toq8ER0UxKb5S.Name: Quickwin 13.5
rec9toq8ER0UxKb5S.Bottom Body:
Not only is Yoga Nirdra great for sleep, this technique helps you build healthier thought patterns and can reduce those racing thoughts you might experience as you try to fall asleep. 

Since it’s considered to be a “conscious sleep” it can actually provide benefits similar to a night of sleep, such as healing and restoring sleep-deprived bodies and managing sleep disorders such as insomnia!

So cool!

Ok, back to journeys...

recAEzrbfwUQJxxTj.Name: Wokeuptired 1.4
recAEzrbfwUQJxxTj.Bottom Body:
**3. Social jet lag**

We all know that jet lag sucks, but do you know about social jet lag? Social jet lag is the term used by sleep experts to describe the disruptions in your circadian rhythm that occur from differences in your sleeping patterns on weekdays vs the weekends. 

It can take your body up to a week to catch up on one hour of missed sleep. This means that significant disruptions to your weekend schedule can actually leave you jet-lagged during the week. Depending on the disruptions, it can be the equivalent of traveling through multiple time zones. 

**Fix it**
If you find yourself extra snoozy in the mornings, have a look at your weekend schedule and work on waking up at the same time every day. 

**TIP:** Waking up early and grabbing a nap in the afternoon is better than sleeping in!

recAHrr47AdUu61xy.Name: sneaky 1.4
recAHrr47AdUu61xy.Bottom Body:
**Sneaky Caffeine**
Caffeine is not just in coffee. You also get a significant dose of caffeine in many teas, sodas, chocolates, and even over-the-counter headache medicine. 

Caffeine shows up as other ingredients like:
- Yerba mate
- Matcha
- Guarana
- Kola

**Easy on the stimulation**
Many over-the-counter diet pills, workout supplements, and energy drinks have huge doses of caffeine that will surely have sleep-disrupting side-effects.

**TIPS**:
- No caffeine after 2pm
- Limit intake to around 400mg/day 
- Read labels and go easy on evening sodas (especially diet sodas since they tend to have more caffeine)

It's possible to enjoy the perks of caffeine and also get good sleep. Keep an eye on your intake and make your evenings stimulation-free to optimize your sleep! 

Ok, on to the next one...

recAITfkK2TeZDVhQ.Name: mythBuster 1.1
recAITfkK2TeZDVhQ.Bottom Body:
There is a lot of misinformation out there about sleep. 

Unfortunately, a lot of these myths can lead to extra stress about your actual sleep needs and what quality sleep looks like!

We want to help you fully understand what good sleep means and what it doesn't. So, let's bust some myths!

This one is about dreaming.

recAWJuJsoZTSF7QA.Name: Quickwin 8.1
recAWJuJsoZTSF7QA.Bottom Body:
Are you ready for another quick win?

These quick wins are designed to really help you create small habits that bring you big results!

Not only can this improve your sleep, but you can do it anytime and anywhere!

Let’s find out what this quick win is...

recAWuwLRXzH9FXIX.Name: Tracking 2.5
recAWuwLRXzH9FXIX.Bottom Body:
**It helps you track progress**

One of the most useful aspects of a sleep diary is that it helps you measure your progress. You can see which tips and techniques work for you to improve your sleep. 

As you try to improve your sleep, a sleep diary can help you determine which things are working for you! 

Everyone is unique and so is their sleep.

recAkWQuzpcvDEoUf.Name: Orientation 1.1
recAkWQuzpcvDEoUf.Bottom Body:
It's Reboot Camp orientation time! We are so excited to teach you more about how to **master your sleep**.

You are now officially up to speed on all of the sleep language we'll be using.  

You've also leveled up your general sleep knowledge. 

All of these sleep smarts you've gained will not only make you excellent at sleep trivia, but they'll also help you understand why we use certain approaches to improve your sleep!

Each week of Reboot camp will build up your base of sleep knowledge and help you gain mastery over each element of good sleep.

recAktcTNFi5d5mMG.Name: Goals 1.4
recAktcTNFi5d5mMG.Bottom Body: The more you practice, the more natural it becomes to set SMART goals.
recAktcTNFi5d5mMG.Top Body:
**Choosing SMART goals that you can work on each week will bring you closer to your overall goal!**

Whether it's putting your phone away 2 hours before bed, not watching TV in bed, or maybe it's getting up at the same time every day – SMART goals will help you get there.

**Get SMART**
Think of a SMART goal right now. If you're feeling dramatic–  use a tube of lipstick to write it on your mirror.  Otherwise, write it here!

**Remember: Specific, Measurable, Relevant, Timely**

recAmZaiaKnf2DcLR.Name: Why  1.6
recAmZaiaKnf2DcLR.Bottom Body:
What we want you to understand is:
- **It's normal to feel stressed when you can't sleep**
- **Your brain is often dramatic about its essential needs**
- **Gaining some mastery over your sleep will help you feel more empowered in every area of your daily functioning!**

Sounds worth the effort, right? We want you to meet the best version of yourself. 

Dedicating your time and efforts to this program will not only help you gain the benefits of better sleep, but it will also make you stronger psychologically. 

It's bicep curls for your brain (brainceps curls?) 

It's brain day every day.

This is your chance to learn how to work with your body's natural rhythms and take back control of your sleep.

recAoPvaKV8QPHKLq.Name: Grogginess 1.1
recAoPvaKV8QPHKLq.Bottom Body:
So you’ve got the groggies. We’re not sure if that’s a real word but we’re sticking with it. 

Feeling groggy, tired, or low energy sucks.

Whether it’s due to missed sleep, disrupted sleep, or it’s out of the blue – there is plenty you can do to still have a good day despite feeling low energy!

But, first of all, let’s take a closer look at the source of those groggy feelings...

recAyMAODeqCUjEma.Name: goalqual 1.1
recAyMAODeqCUjEma.Bottom Body:
We want to help you reach your goal of getting higher quality sleep for the health benefits. 

**Defining your goal**
Sleep has incredible health benefits. By optimizing your sleep schedule, working with your body's natural rhythms, and implementing sleep-enhancing strategies, you can reap the many benefits that good sleep has to offer.

To get you started, we're going to talk about two things you can do to help you get higher quality sleep!

1. **Move it**  
2. **Add noise**

recAyprif1PbyGsgP.Name: Bedroom 1.5
recAyprif1PbyGsgP.Bottom Body:
**KEEP YOUR ELECTRONICS OUT OF THE BEDROOM!**

You should avoid having any electronics in your bedroom, if possible, to avoid blue light exposure before bedtime. 

Make the decision today that your bedroom is for sleep (or sex) only and keep your electronics in another room!

If you absolutely can’t avoid it, try using dark tape or other coverings over digital lights at night. 

**Can having electronics in your room really be that bad?**

Yes, let’s find out how.

recBEcia09hbdZiYG.Name: Quickwin 10.3
recBEcia09hbdZiYG.Bottom Body:
Being well prepared for helping lull yourself back to sleep is an excellent strategy that can ease frustration on those nights that sleep doesn’t seem to come. 

Having a nightstand packed with these essentials is sure to send you on a journey back to dreamland. 

Now, let’s journey back onto Reboot Camp!

recBSImXBCx7RqYGE.Name: Bedroom 1.6
recBSImXBCx7RqYGE.Bottom Body:
**No TV in bed!**

Did you know if you’re falling asleep to your favorite tv show at night, then you’re exposing your brain to blue light through the entire night?! If the sound is on you’re disrupting your sleep even more. 

Research has shown that even if you don’t wake up, TV and environmental sounds through the night disrupt the quality of your sleep. 

Additionally, depending on what you watch, the content can be stimulating or emotionally driven in a way that can make it hard to quiet your mind.

If you absolutely refuse to remove your TV, avoid watching it within an hour of bedtime as it can be disruptive to sleep quality. We highly suggest you remove it, though. Please remove it?

recBU4VwUQLFlmbSM.Name: spower 1.2
recBU4VwUQLFlmbSM.Bottom Body:
Sleep is a funny thing, isn't it? Every night of your life, your body powers down into a coma-like state. 

As you there, mostly motionless, your brain stays very active, even playing its own homemade movies during the night.

But, how does the quality of your sleep impact your daily life?

recBfwOG08gQ009QV.Name: QuickWinFA 10.2
recBfwOG08gQ009QV.Bottom Body:
**Paradoxical intention**

This tip is going to sound kind of funny, but it works. Believe it or not, for many people, telling yourself to stay awake can actually cause you to fall asleep faster!

**What?how?why?**
Trying to sleep can increase anxiety. It also leads to subconscious sleep stress which can make the problem worsen.

If you are regularly stressed out about falling asleep, worried about the consequences of sleep loss, or "striving for sleep" –  trying to stay awake may be your ticket to falling asleep faster!

**How do I do it?**

recBkI7AiuL67Y3Ds.Name: Decompression 1.5
recBkI7AiuL67Y3Ds.Bottom Body:
**Progressive Muscle Relaxation (PMR)!**

Research has found that PMR increases your levels of mental quiet and joy. It can even help reduce pain!

PMR is perfect for mental decompression and can teach your body to fall asleep quicker!

There are plenty of guided tracks available. 

**You can start simple by following these steps:**

1. Lay comfortably in bed with your eyes closed
2. Beginning with your face and tense each muscle group as you breathe in then release the muscle group as you breathe out
3. Work your way down your body, tensing and relaxing each muscle group

This simple technique counteracts your flight-or-flight response which lowers physiological stress! In other words, it sends signals to your brain that it's "relax time."

recBn9viS6NDjrRwF.Name: Architecture 1.2
recBn9viS6NDjrRwF.Bottom Body:
**Stages on stages**
During the night you move through several stages of sleep. These stages each have specific benefits and unique qualities. Your sleep architecture is your pattern of sleep stages across the night.

Stages 1 and 2 include lighter sleep while stage 3 includes deep restorative sleep. REM sleep is primarily when you dream, and you spend more time dreaming in the second half of the night. 

We'll learn more about sleep stages later.

For now, let's focus on a quick tip to optimize sleep architecture!

recBncS1g1Y26BdKr.Name: QuickwinFA4.4
recBncS1g1Y26BdKr.Bottom Body:
**Boosting your melatonin the natural way**
Your body starts producing melatonin around 2 hours before bedtime, so dimming the lights during that time period and using a red lightbulb beside your bed are excellent techniques to optimize this process. 

Check out this [article](https://intercom.help/rested-health/en/articles/5187543-how-to-naturally-boost-melatonin) for more tips on how to boost your melatonin levels naturally. 

See? You'll be falling asleep faster in no time.

recBprjvlstBUygt5.Name: general 1.5
recBprjvlstBUygt5.Bottom Body:
**2. Managing stress in the moment**
Learning how to effectively calm your body when you feel stressed or overwhelmed is extremely valuable. There are many techniques and tools! Let's look at an awesome and effective one!

**The 333 rule**
Whenever you find yourself caught up in stressful thoughts, irritability or feeling overwhelmed – use the 333 rule. 

You can use your imagination if you're in bed, or use your surrounding if out of bed.

Here's how it works: 

**Step 1:** Look around you and name three things you see

**Step 2:** Look around you and name three sounds you hear

**Step 3:** One at a time, move three parts of your body (such as your ankle, fingers, or arm). 

This technique will help center you and pull you out of any unhelpful thought patterns!

recBxPx8Tfh00fwaL.Name: spower 1.5
recBxPx8Tfh00fwaL.Bottom Body:
**Fun fact:** Your brain shrinks by 20% when you sleep- the space between neurons shrinks so they can recharge and normalize for the next day!

Pull that one out at your next family gathering!

**Your brain on sleep**
Good sleep boosts your productivity, can help ward off cognitive diseases like dementia, and improves your memory and creative thinking. 

See? We told you sleep was great for your mind. Now, let's look at sleep and mood!

recC0eubKQBxIE3db.Name: QuickwinFA 12.1
recC0eubKQBxIE3db.Bottom Body:
Quick Win time! 

This one focuses on food.

Did you know that certain foods can actually help you sleep better?

Some foods contain magnesium, tryptophan, and even melatonin. In case you didn’t know, each one of these compounds is helpful for sleep. 

For this quick win, let’s take a look at some sleep-inducing snacks with melatonin...

recCMe5wwahm4KTNa.Name: racingmind 1.4
recCMe5wwahm4KTNa.Bottom Body:
**Using your own physiology**
This technique is powerful because deep breathing triggers your body's "calm down" response. This opens up enough space for you to practice being in the moment, or mindfulness, by repeating a soothing mantra. 

You can create your own mantra as well! 

**The dream team (quite literally)**
The combination of deep breathing plus a soothing mantra is an extremely powerful way to quiet a busy mind before bed. 

We'll give you a lot of other ways to calm a busy mind before sleep. You should definitely try this one out next time this is a problem and see how well it works for you. 

ok, back to journeys!

recCPfkSB18yOlZQf.Name: Bedroom 1.8
recCPfkSB18yOlZQf.Bottom Body:
**The cellphone needs to go as well!**

I know, I know, we are seriously no fun. But you will sleep better, which means you’ll have more energy to have more fun!

Refrain from using your phone for anything other than playing meditation tracks or other sleep-related activities. If it’s too tempting, just leave the phone in another room or in a drawer. If it does stay nearby, make sure to place it face down or use night mode to keep it from disrupting your slumber. 

But, if you **must**. Remember to use blue light blocking programs or glasses!

Now, let’s journey on to some bedtime basics!

recCQZnxyZGrrbwdi.Name: Quickwin 7.1
recCQZnxyZGrrbwdi.Bottom Body:
It’s time for another Reboot Camp Quick Win!

This one might seem a little bizarre, but _trust us_!

You’ve likely come across this technique, but you may not know that it can have excellent benefits for your sleep! It can help you fall asleep faster and improve your deep sleep.

What is it?

recCSJRbP1Vlkg9jm.Name: BedtimeBasics 1.4
recCSJRbP1Vlkg9jm.Bottom Body:
**Picking those sheets**

Try **cotton, silk, or bamboo** fabrics. They are excellent for temperature control. 

If you want to indulge a little, go with an **Egyptian cotton or pima cotton** which are combed with precision to remove all impurities. A sateen finish is often preferred due to it’s smooth feel on the skin. 

If you live somewhere with seasons you may want to have specific sheets for each season. Try a jersey sheet in winter and a lighter sheet for summer. 

**Sheets to avoid**: Stay away from synthetics fabrics like polyester, which trap heat and can leave you feeling hot and sweaty at night.

recCXXLANUH346AZF.Name: QuickwinFA 6.4
recCXXLANUH346AZF.Bottom Body:
So, this super simple task can help you **start and end your day off in the right way.**

It will also help you fall asleep faster and kick things off on a positive and productive note (with minimal effort).

Win, win, win!

recCbhhO3X71rAx8a.Name: Intro 0.2
recCbhhO3X71rAx8a.Bottom Body:
Researchers have found that up to **70% of people report being sleep-deprived** each month!

If you struggle with sleep, you aren't alone. 

In fact, sleep deprivation is such a widespread problem it has been declared a **public health epidemic by the CDC**.
 
But is sleep deprivation actually a big deal?

Heck yeah, it is...

recCf3w8jhTOAG1tj.Name: relearn 1.4 copy
recCf3w8jhTOAG1tj.Bottom Body:
**2. Leave the bed when you can’t sleep**

This is another tip we’ll repeat because it deserves repetition. If you are laying in bed trying to sleep and it’s been longer than 20 minutes – leave the bed!

**Why?** Because by laying in bed feeling alert and building mounting frustration over your inability to sleep, you are building unhelpful associations between your bed and those feelings. 

**Where do you go?** Ideally, go somewhere that you can relax and do something boring. You can head to your living room, a cozy nook, or any room other than your bedroom. 

The important thing is to just get out of bed! 

**But, follow these guidelines...**

recChjqggZsFIBEII.Name: Sleep Basics 101 Overview 1.3
recChjqggZsFIBEII.Bottom Body:
Your circadian rhythm works closely with your sleep drive (the dynamic duo of your sleep!) to keep your sleep-wake cycle at its healthiest!

Your sleep drive is your body’s need for sleep.

Adenosine is a brain chemical that builds all day while you’re awake and creates **sleep pressure.**

Your sleep pressure will peak after 12-16 hours of being awake, and it will cause you to feel uncontrollably sleepy.

recCvgFC4x4rFXdaR.Name: Supplements 1.2
recCvgFC4x4rFXdaR.Bottom Body:
There are many natural and safe supplements that can help ease your stress, relax your body, and help improve your sleep!

**What about prescription sleep aids?**

Unfortunately, many prescriptions and over-the-counter medications are overused. They are meant as short-term solutions due to the fact most are habit-forming and can reduce the quality of sleep. Talk to your doctor if you’d like to be weaned off of your current sleep meds!

**Supplements for sleep**

To get you started, we’re going to cover the basic supplements to consider if you’re having issues with sleep. Later on, if you want more, we’ll start diving into some more advanced supplement stacks.

recCy3xCI9pOs8Yk9.Name: Onboarding 1.5
recCy3xCI9pOs8Yk9.Bottom Body:
**3. Sleep Architecture.**

In the same way that architecture describes the design and construction of buildings, **sleep architecture describes how our sleep is designed and built.**

During the night you move through several stages of sleep. These stages each have specific benefits and unique qualities. 

Your sleep architecture is your pattern of sleep stages across the night (and ironically enough, it looks like a city skyline).

Certain habits and activities during the day can impact your sleep architecture in different ways. This is why sometimes you feel more or less Rested with the same amount of sleep!

Now that we have you pumped the heck up to learn about sleep science, we can really dive in!

recD3M50wYxEKplC7.Name: Electronics 1.5
recD3M50wYxEKplC7.Bottom Body:
**Evenings with blue light**
Blue light exposure in the evening can be pretty darn disruptive to your sleep! Here’s how:

1. **It stimulates your brain**: Blue light boosts your mental alertness.
2. **You absorb allllllll of it**: Blue light is the most energizing light you can expose yourself to and your eyes are unable to naturally filter it out.
3. **It suppresses melatonin**: Blue light exposure suppresses melatonin production (you probably remember this is our _get sleepy_ brain chemical) two times longer than other types of light!
4. **Unhelpful learned associations**: It can cause you to associate your bed with activities other than sleep. This can make it harder for your brain to feel relaxed and sleepy at bedtime.

Yikes!

recDGCAEEkBv5FHNy.Name: Grogginess 1.2
recDGCAEEkBv5FHNy.Bottom Body:
**Sleep deprivation messes with your brain**

When you sleep, your brain takes that time to recharge. When you don’t get enough sleep, your neurons actually get tired too! They fire more slowly, leading to poor concentration, slower reaction times, irritability, and can affect your balance and coordination

**Other causes of low energy**

Low energy can also be a result of vitamin or mineral deficiencies, depression, stress overload, allergies, or various other factors. 

So, now we know why you feel bad, but how can you fix it?

recDKWjOjmxLaBC1X.Name: QuickwinFA 9.5
recDKWjOjmxLaBC1X.Bottom Body:
Repeating positive phrases right before bed is a potent time because it directly impacts your subconscious mind. Remember subconscious sleep stress? Positive affirmations are a great way to combat it. 

Try one tonight, and see how it works for you!

recDRG2HxdUV1cnFT.Name: QuickwinFA 6.3
recDRG2HxdUV1cnFT.Bottom Body:
A nice, crisp, made bed will give your bedroom that **cozy and inviting feeling** that every great sleep environment should have!

Not only that, but your brain sees an unmade bed as clutter, and clutter screams “CHAOS” and makes it difficult for your mind to wind down at the end of the day.

Remove the clutter and you remove the chaos. 

Making your bed first thing in the morning will help you induce immediate unconscious relaxation when you step into your bedroom at the end of the day!

recDlJDazEZwyYDrU.Name: QuickwinFA 12.3
recDlJDazEZwyYDrU.Bottom Body:
**Sleep-inducing snacks and the amount of melatonin per gram:**
- Tart cherries (13 ng/g or .003 mg/8 ounces)
- Black mustard seed (129 ng/g or .0014 mg/Tbsp)
- Almonds (39 ng/g or .001 mg/ounce)
- Lentils (5 ng/g or .0009 mg/198 grams cooked)
- Barley (6 ng/g or .0009 mg/157 grams cooked)
- Oats (7 ng/g or .0005 mg/80 grams cooked)

**Other good sources **
- Eggs (1.54 ng/g)
- Rice (1.72 ng/g)
- Ginger (1.42 ng/g)

recDrdTZNL2P5yyMP.Name: Tracking 1.7
recDrdTZNL2P5yyMP.Bottom Body:
**Wrist wearables**

They use sensors to detect physiological signs like heart rate, body temperature, and movement. 

**Popular types of wrist wearables:**
- **Smart Watches** (Apple, Samsung Galaxy, Fitbit Versa)
- **Activity Trackers** (Fitbit, Amazfit, Garmin, Whoop) 

**Pros**: Easy to wear with many affordable options available.

recDvClHKFSr0zIiY.Name: change 1.5
recDvClHKFSr0zIiY.Bottom Body:
**3. Consistency**

Remember when you learned all about conditioning and how we are very much still animals? Keep that in mind. 

One of the most common reasons people fail to reach their goals is because they lack consistency. In order to make a new skill or habit become automatic, you need to practice. 

**Motivation vs discipline**
One of the most important tidbits of advice we want you to swallow is that you **shouldn't always depend on motivation**. 

While motivation is essential for mustering up the desire to change, it's not what carries you over the finish line. 

**So, like, what carries me over the finish line?** 
Discipline and consistency! The cold hard truth about behaviour change is that it takes hard work and sometimes the motivation simply isn't there. Be consistent and constantly ask yourself:

**"Does this activity bring me closer to my goals?"**

recE0pVrQJOzE1h8p.Name: BedtimeBasics 1.2
recE0pVrQJOzE1h8p.Bottom Body:
**Let’s spend some time in the SHEETS!**

Heh heh

There is no better feeling in the world than climbing into fresh sheets at the end of a long day, right?

But, did you know that your sheets can impact your sleep?

The quality of your sheets can actually have a big impact on how well you sleep. Don’t worry, expensive isn’t always better. 

Let’s look at some guidelines to follow when choosing the material you’ll spend a third of your life in...

recE5iBtf5yjJxvhC.Name: Lighting 1.2
recE5iBtf5yjJxvhC.Bottom Body:
**Dim lights one hour before bedtime!**

About one hour before you’d like to be sleeping you should make an effort to use dimmed lighting to help induce relaxation. In an ideal world you’d dim them at two hours before sleep (that’s when your body starts pumping melatonin). To get started, one hour is enough.

**How to dim them**
That could mean installing dimmer switches where possible or just using lamp light with 40 watt light bulbs instead of turning on overhead lights.

This will help better ready your body for sleep and it’ll even make things more cozy! 

See, that’s such an easy tip that you can start doing tonight!

Want another one?

recEAGD6eOhGz131E.Name: Mornings 1.7
recEAGD6eOhGz131E.Bottom Body:
What’s the best way to get fresh air and sunshine?

**Walk it out!**

Grab your pet, spouse, or your headphones and head on out for a morning walk. Breathe in that fresh morning air, and as a bonus, you’ll be getting some of that wonderful mood-boosting sunlight, too!

These might sound like basic tips, but they work. Even just getting out in the sun three times a week can give you a boost to your mood and sleep. 

See? Morning can be pretty nice. 

We’ll get into some more advanced techniques later. For now, remember:

1. **Grab a glass of water when you wake up**
2. **Get some morning sunshine**

Start out with these tips and begin building yourself a little morning ritual that brings you some health and joy.

recEI8qpLyK6OdXW6.Name: Needs 1.2
recEI8qpLyK6OdXW6.Bottom Body:
**Some important reminders for you:** 
- The number of hours you get each night can vary
- Quality over quantity
- It's normal to have multiple awakenings during the night
- Sleep is never perfect
- You won't die from missing out on sleep

**Awareness is power**
Understanding that sleep is never perfect will help you better cope with those times when you aren't getting your ideal sleep.

Taking control of your sleep doesn't mean getting perfect sleep every night. Nobody sleeps that well! (ok, maaaaaybe Sleeping Beauty did, but she wasn't exactly productive).

recEIzOcY2OShptsU.Name: general 1.4
recEIzOcY2OShptsU.Bottom Body:
**Visualization for stress relief**

You can pick any setting you want. Here's an example of visualizing a relaxing time at a beach.

**Step 1:** Sit or lay in a comfortable position and close your eyes

**Step 2:** relax the muscles in your face and take a deep breath in through your nose and out through your mouth

**Step 3:** Imagine you are resting on a white sandy beach. You can hear the waves gently rolling and you can feel the warm sun on your face. Visualize the turquoise water. Smell the sweet salty air. Feel the gentle breeze across your skin. Listen to the gentle crash as the waves reach the shore. 

Allow your breath to slow and match the rolling waves. Stay as long as you like. 

**Ahhhh that was nice.** 

Now let's look at a quick stress relief technique for when you're in the moment with stress!

recEPx5zoky6SaT7J.Name: QuickwinFA 1.5
recEPx5zoky6SaT7J.Bottom Body:
Try grabbing a warm bath or shower around 1-2 hours before your desired bedtime. Stay in there at least 10 minutes (you can stay longer if you want, we don't pay your water bill) and notice how much it helps you sleep!

That's it for today's Quick Win. 

We started simply because this one is super effective and easy! 

But, don't worry, we have many more of these sweet little tidbits coming your way that will help you fall asleep faster! 

Ok, back to journeys (or break time?)

recERc4A6Z2Ho2pHH.Name: to know you 1.4
recERc4A6Z2Ho2pHH.Bottom Body: Great, thank you for answering. We want you to reach all of your sleep goals. With the support of your journeys, sleep coach, and the sleep library – you will find all the tools you need to master your sleep.

recESMhvOGLFtPMZ6.Name: Grogginess 1.6
recESMhvOGLFtPMZ6.Bottom Body:
**Napping!**

While some people find that naps can be disruptive to their nightly slumber, others find them to be helpful.

Naps can have many health-boosting benefits and can help overcome some of the side effects of sleep loss or fatigue.

Follow these nap guidelines:

1. Nap for no more than 20 minutes.
2. Time your nap for between 1pm - 3pm

Ok, one last energy booster for you...

recEbMtw7RjXVhBIh.Name: worry 1.2
recEbMtw7RjXVhBIh.Bottom Body:
**Your subconscious mind**
Before we talk about subconscious sleep stress, let's talk about your subconscious mind! 

Your subconscious mind controls about 99% of your actions and interpretations during the day. It is 100% in control during sleep. 

**What does my subconscious mind do?**

Similar to a computer, your subconscious mind creates programs for how your body should behave in certain situations. From stopping at red lights to smiling at cute dogs, it's got a program for everything. 

You build these programs from interacting with your world, repeating certain habits or activities, and learning new skills.

recEkEhoqSwngN8yv.Name: boostnight 1.2
recEkEhoqSwngN8yv.Bottom Body:
Because new habits are a little trickier to form in the evening, it's important that you rely more on discipline than motivation. 

As you select changes you want to make, set clear boundaries for yourself ahead of time so that you can minimize the mental effort you need at night. 

Always repeat this: **"Does this activity bring me closer to my goals?"**

OK, let's take a look at how to boost your night!

recEkMcVeF9Mn4xZ9.Name: HypeUp 1.1
recEkMcVeF9Mn4xZ9.Bottom Body:
Here we are! Week 2 of Reboot Camp!

You’ve already made it through the core stuff. You rock!!!

In the spirit of building a foundation, before we jump into what we’re going to learn this week, let’s take a quick little minute to recap last week, shall we?

Yes, we shall!

recEuNUYVzBfYpOYf.Name: Tracking 1.2
recEuNUYVzBfYpOYf.Bottom Body:
**Benefits of wearables**
Wearables have cool features that give you interesting information about your sleep (and health). Some of them even allow you to set smart alarms that wake you up when your sleep is the lightest! 

**Use with caution**
Wearables aren’t meant as diagnostic tools, but they will give you a general idea of your sleep patterns. 

**Sleep trackers aren’t for everyone** and that’s ok. If tracking your sleep causes more stress than benefits, you can scrap it!

recF0Smta8lWVw7id.Name: Onboarding1.3
recF0Smta8lWVw7id.Bottom Body:
**1. Circadian Rhythm**

What is it? It’s just a biological clock! Similar to how you organize your daily schedule, your brain organizes your various bodily schedules with a “biological clock”. 

Your biological clock has **24-hour cycle circadian rhythms** running in the background which regulate processes like hormone production, body temperature, metabolism, and your **sleep-wake cycle**. 

So, like, all the good stuff. 

You may have guessed this already, but your sleep-wake cycle is pretty important.

recF23fwgdLwR6eyU.Name: boostday 1.1
recF23fwgdLwR6eyU.Bottom Body:
You now have a headstart on building a morning routine that improves your sleep. 

But, what about daytime?

Your daily activities can have a huge impact on how well you sleep. We'll cover all the important stuff with you in time. 

First, let's focus on the most important and essential activities you can do each day to improve the quality of your sleep!

recFDFjAewChGXn1I.Name: Tracking 2.4
recFDFjAewChGXn1I.Bottom Body:
**You’ll get more proactive about your sleep**

A sleep diary not only creates awareness but also gives you a sense of accountability. 

You’ll find that keeping a diary will naturally make you more diligent about engaging in behaviors that promote sleep. 

**Ch-ch-ch-changes**
Logging behaviors leads to changes! For instance, if you got the absolute best sleep of your life the day you went on a long bike ride– you’ll probably have more motivation to go on long bike rides. 

If watching crime documentaries before bed gave you nightmares– you might skip that activity in the future. 

WAIT– THERE’S MORE!

recFMdRkWzZVMVrfk.Name: quickwin 3.4
recFMdRkWzZVMVrfk.Bottom Body:
Try and combine a new habit this week with an existing one. It may take some trial and error to see what works, but, habit-stacking is an excellent technique to set yourself up for success. 

Awesome! Let's get on to our next journey!

recFMwIbQERApt8eq.Name: change 1.6
recFMwIbQERApt8eq.Bottom Body:
**4. Accountability/Support**

The final roadblock that many people face is a lack of accountability or support. 

In order to get to where you want to be it requires tracking your progress and getting the support you need. 

Tracking is essential for evaluating your goals and making adjustments and changes as needed. Support gives those little boosts you need along the way. 

**How do I get support and accountability?**
Support can come in the form of family, social networks, and professional support systems (like Rested Health). 

As for accountability? Write down your goals, track your progress, tell people about your changes, and lean into your support systems! 

We'll give you some more specific tips for tracking your sleep progress as well.

recFZjp7Kzpez3Jms.Name: caffeinesleep 1.6
recFZjp7Kzpez3Jms.Bottom Body:
There you have it! Your official guide to using caffeine AND getting good sleep. 

**As a recap:**
**Rule #1**: Don't consume caffeine within the first 90 minutes of waking up
**Rule #2:** Don't drink caffeine too late in the day
**Rule #3:** Moderation is key
**Helpful Tip:** Stack caffeine with L-Theanine

Remember to watch out for sneaky caffeine and do your best to limit your intake to around 400mg a day (that's around 3.5 cups)

recFaTh2cdvawWe7T.Name: wakingup 1.5
recFaTh2cdvawWe7T.Bottom Body:
**Getting Hygge with it**
Hygge (pronounced hue-guh) is the Danish and Norwegian word for coziness. In general, hygge refers to the concept of happiness and encompasses all things cozy and relaxing. 

We don’t expect you to go completely hygge, but by borrowing from the concept, it’s possible to create a corner of your home that evokes hygge. Not only will this give you a space to relax, but it will also serve as an important refuge for you on sleepless nights. 

**If you build it, sleep will come**
Select a section of your home (away from your bed) where you can retreat on sleepless nights. Equip it with cozy blankets, pillows, books, candles, fairy lights, and whatever else evokes relaxation and comfort. 

This is now your refuge of comfort when you need to leave your bed and relax. Once you feel sleepy again, simply head back to bed. If sleep still won't come? Back to hygge.

recFiI5zZMIoNpX0u.Name: Quickwin 12.3
recFiI5zZMIoNpX0u.Bottom Body:
Grabbing any of these snacks in the evening is a great way to fill your belly with healthy food and also improve your sleep. Eat them alone or combine them! Oatmeal and salmon anyone? (this isn’t a recipe app, ok?)

You can also incorporate them as a part of a healthy lifestyle to optimize your body’s production of these important brain chemicals. 

Food is connected to every body process, we’ll be sure to flag all of the ones that can help you sleep!

Ok, back to journeys...

recFjO9oJPNnTvgC2.Name: Intake
recFjO9oJPNnTvgC2.Bottom Body:
In order to help you improve your sleep, we need to know a little bit more about your problems. 

**Help us help you**
The following questions will gather information about your sleep habits, goals, and things you've done in the past to improve your sleep. 

Answer honestly! The purpose of the questions is to guide the sort of advice we give you. 

**Block a little time**
This journey may take around 5-10 minutes and will require you to answer several questions. Come back later if this isn't a great time for that. 

Otherwise, let's get to know you better!

recFs9kSO0jN43XcI.Name: caffeinesleep 1.7
recFs9kSO0jN43XcI.Bottom Body:
**Rule #3**
**Moderation is key**

Research shows that the healthy caffeine limit for most adults is 250- 400 mg. That's about 3-4 cups of coffee. 

Get your caffeine fix in before 2 pm (or 6 hours before bed) to avoid the lingering anti-sleep effects of caffeine.

recFzPoYj2qoC24S0.Name: general 1.6
recFzPoYj2qoC24S0.Bottom Body:
Learning how to effectively manage stress will vastly improve your quality of life. 

To get started at kicking stress in the butt: Try implementing some visual or guided imagery into your nightly winddown routine and use the 333 method any time you find yourself feeling stressed or overwhelmed. 

Learning how to find calm in the midst of any storm will serve you greatly. You can do it. Your mind is a powerful tool. 

Ok, back to journeys!

recG0HURjiR58Zovn.Name: irrationalThoughts 1.2
recG0HURjiR58Zovn.Bottom Body:
Fortunately, it's possible to deal with these cognitive distortions! 

Psychologists use a technique called **cognitive restructuring**.

Cognitive restructuring is an extremely effective way to deal with thoughts that are unhelpful by challenging them! 

**Here's how it works:**

**Step 1:** Identify the irrational or exaggerated thought
**Step 2:** List any supporting evidence for or against it 
**Step 3:** Try reframing the thought in a way that's more in line with the supporting evidence. 

Let's use an example...

recG9cwkidRFTtXzi.Name: QuickwinFA 7.1
recG9cwkidRFTtXzi.Bottom Body:
Ready for another Reboot Camp Quick Win!?

This next one can provide a plethora of health benefits! 

In addition to improving your overall quality of sleep, it can **help you to fall asleep faster** AND it may even decrease your risk of dementia!

Want to know what it is? Do ya? DO YA? (Sorry to yell, just got really excited there)

recGJg61wtlxRtVet.Name: goalqual 1.4
recGJg61wtlxRtVet.Bottom Body:
Improving your sleep quality will bring great health benefits. 

There are many things you can do to boost how well you sleep. To get you started, try exercising a little more and get yourself a noise machine for sleep. 

Getting that heart rate up for just 10 minutes a day can give you health benefits, so don't worry about starting small. Just get started! 

We'll continue to give you more tips that move you closer to your goal of better quality sleep! For now, try these tips and notice how well they work for you.

recGV8QPx9cDYWkH8.Name: Why Rested 1.1
recGV8QPx9cDYWkH8.Bottom Body:
It's possible that you've already tried a lot of things. We get it. We also want you to trust us when we say that this is different.

**How is this different?**
Sleep is our business. That means we've recruited the greatest minds in sleep to create a program unlike any other. 

By using techniques from the best in sleep therapy based on thousands of clients, we have created a program that gives you:
- Actionable advice
- Personalized content
- Tips that work (we _really_ like science, and we _really_ like results)

Let us take the stress out of sleep.

recGe8lCFqXAWspyn.Name: Circadian 1.3
recGe8lCFqXAWspyn.Bottom Body:
**Environmental cues that regulate your sleep-wake cycle**
Environmental cues that affect your circadian rhythm are referred to as zeitgebers (it’s a German word that means “time giver”). Zeitgebers send important signals that keep your inner schedules regular. 

The key environmental cues that impact sleep are:
- Light 
- Temperature
- Eating
- Activity

Let’s take a closer look at how each one of these zeitgebers impacts your circadian rhythm...

recGkVxWcsfibbkZN.Name: models  1.3
recGkVxWcsfibbkZN.Bottom Body:
**﻿1. Unconsciously incompetent:** "I don't realize I have a problem, so I don't know I need to fix it"

In order to get the most out of this program, it's important to start at the bottom of the ladder. 

**Why?** 
Even if you already know a bunch of stuff about sleep, starting here will help you honestly identify your strengths and weaknesses. 

It will also set you up for success because no matter how much effort you put into something, **you won't get better if you're focusing on the wrong areas**!

**Slow and steady**
One of the most common reasons people give up is because they are **too eager to reach the top**. 

**How do I move up a rung?**
You simply have to keep an open mind and a motivation to learn! So, if you have thoughts like "I've tried that, it doesn't work", remind yourself that you're starting something new and you're starting from the bottom rung. 

Sound good? Let's look at the next rung on the ladder of competence...

recGnQaZ8A2dqTqSV.Name: Foundations 1.3
recGnQaZ8A2dqTqSV.Bottom Body:
Improving your sleep will require you to build a foundation of:

- Basic fundamental sleep knowledge
- Good habits
- Quick wins
- SMART goals 

We’ve designed this course in a way that will give you all the tools you need to become an expert foundation builder. 

“I’m an expert foundation builder now” -_you, after completing Reboot Camp_

recGpuHnvCoOphTas.Name: Why 1.4
recGpuHnvCoOphTas.Bottom Body:
**Your brain is a bit of a helicopter parent sometimes**

Unfortunately, your mind often reacts with automatic panic to things that are essential needs. So, while your brain isn't lying to you, it is overreacting. 

Don't worry, we'll teach you some skills to combat the drama!

**Ok, cool, but it still sucks** 
Living a life where you never feel like you're getting enough sleep sucks. In addition to making you feel generally crappy, sleep issues impact the entire structure of our being. 

**Wait, what? How?**

recGxPSGigs5igIVD.Name: Foundations 1.4
recGxPSGigs5igIVD.Bottom Body:
As we tackle each of the foundations of good sleep, you’ll be setting new goals, making changes, and monitoring what works for you. 

By the end of Reboot Camp, you’ll feel confident in your ability to gain mastery over your sleep!

Just keep in mind – slow and steady makes you sleep ready (we made that up but at least it rhymes)

recH3kNscI9JGotSA.Name: QuickwinFA2.3
recH3kNscI9JGotSA.Bottom Body:
**Grounding techniques** 
Grounding techniques are quick and easy to implement. They rely on your senses to help pull your mind out of unhelpful thought patterns and bring you back to the present. 

It's basically just creating a distraction from..umm.. yourself.

One of the most effective grounding techniques for sleep is...

**Making lists!**

Let's explore how...

recHIojNG7qmada9C.Name: wakingup 1.2
recHIojNG7qmada9C.Bottom Body:
**1. Mental decompression routine**

We'll give you guidance on how to create an awesome bedtime routine later. For now, let's look at a very helpful decompression technique for people who regularly wake up in the middle of the night feeling stressed. 

It is **journaling!** There are a lot of ways you can approach journaling (you'll meet those later). The absolute best journaling technique for people who wake up stressed is: Making to-do lists. 

**Why a to-do list?** 
Spending 10 to 20 minutes writing out to-do lists and tasks for the next day gives your mind a chance to close up any loose ends on the day and feel secure and ready for the day ahead. 

It's basically like giving your brain permission to go offline!

recHJOg26r3NMIQU4.Name: Sleepdrive 1.4
recHJOg26r3NMIQU4.Bottom Body:
**Your circadian alerting system!**
This super neat alerting system contrasts the building sleep pressure of your sleep drive!

During your waking hours, your circadian alerting system sends arousal signals (oh la la) so you won’t fall asleep prematurely.

By the end of the day, your circadian rhythm turns off this alerting system so that your body can receive the signals from your sleep drive that it’s _finallyyyyy_ time to sleep.

recHaHUT7Xjf2Z3IS.Name: QuickwinFA2.2
recHaHUT7Xjf2Z3IS.Bottom Body:
**Stress vs Sleep**
So, we just learned all about how stress can impact sleep. 

One of the most common issues people have when they can't fall asleep is a busy mind. Whether you get caught in looping thoughts, ruminating over events, or stressing about tomorrow, it can feel impossible to quiet your own thoughts sometimes. 

**Why?** Because our minds often form automatic thought loops. 

**How do you stop it?** Prevention is always ideal (a proper decompression routine), but sometimes we need a quick fix in a bind. 

**Grounding Techniques** has entered the chat!

recHaKoBtr4JZtkpx.Name: Overview 2.4
recHaKoBtr4JZtkpx.Bottom Body:
**How your diet might impact your sleep**

Avoid snack-related sleep disruptions by having your **last snack at least 3 hours before bedtime**, or choose snacks that are not high-sugar, high-fat, or spicy.

Adequate hydration is known for improving sleep. **Hydrate your way to better sleep** by choosing to **drink water** and including **lots of fruits and veggies in your diet**!

There are also many natural and safe supplements that can improve your sleep such as **multivitamins, vitamin D, iron, and magnesium**!

recHb4xFxOXUexoQe.Name: Overview 2.6
recHb4xFxOXUexoQe.Bottom Body:
**Why you wake up feeling tired**
We talked about all kinds of reasons why you might wake up feeling tired (even if you feel like you slept well) including:
1. You didn’t get enough deep restorative sleep.
2. You woke up on the wrong side of your sleep cycle
3. Social jet lag from differences in your sleeping patterns on weekdays vs weekends

**How to beat it?**
1. **Fake it til you make it**. When you wake up tired, try thinking “I feel good, I feel energized, I’m going to have a good day.”
2. **Try a green smoothie.** Drinking one every day can seriously improve your energy levels!
3. **Take a little nap.** Aim to have your nap between 1-3pm and nap for no more than 20 minutes!

**Pair your coffee with L-Theanine. **Taking a dose of 50 mg of L-Theanine with 100 mg of caffeine can significantly improve attention and cognitive performance!

recHevRItZk2WpiSm.Name: Supplements 1.6
recHevRItZk2WpiSm.Bottom Body:
That covers the very basics. As we said, we’ll do a deeper dive into more supplements. For now, focus on getting your basics in order with vitamin d, a multivitamin, iron, and magnesium. 

If you’re feeling sassy, you can try out using hops before bed this week to see if it helps you!

Also, **make sure you always talk to your doctor before beginning or stopping any medications or supplements**!

recHh0FXurDtj3NDg.Name: getRidStress 1.3
recHh0FXurDtj3NDg.Bottom Body: Great! Let's get started on showing you some stress management techniques made just for you!

recHhrJRwWC8Ym1oG.Name: Noise 1.1
recHhrJRwWC8Ym1oG.Bottom Body:
The next thing we are going to focus on when creating a sleep sanctuary is your **sleep environment.**

The best environment for sleeping is a quiet one. 

Why?

**Even if noise doesn't wake you up – your brain still processes noise while you’re asleep!**

recHkHortDEhTVK2e.Name: Quickwin 11.3
recHkHortDEhTVK2e.Bottom Body:
As much as society loves the “BEEEP BEEP BEEP” sound of a traditional alarm clock, being abruptly jolted from your slumber is not always the best greeting in the morning.

So why not try a light alarm?

**...What exactly are light alarms?**

Instead of the melodious BEEEEEEP, light alarms wake you up by shining a bright light. It basically mimics a sunrise in your own bedroom.

recHrxrjxgPEB7W2w.Name: quickwinFA 3.4
recHrxrjxgPEB7W2w.Bottom Body:
Try and combine a new habit this week with an existing one. It may take some trial and error to see what works, but, habit-stacking is an excellent technique to set yourself up for success. 

Awesome! Let's get on back to our next journey!

recI1wYGv0RnjAyIV.Name: intake 1.4
recI1wYGv0RnjAyIV.Bottom Body: In your own words, what would success look like from using this program?

recIIjwe1lPHHm9N3.Name: goals 1.7
recIIjwe1lPHHm9N3.Bottom Body:
Great! Let's get started on that!

(Don't forget to test out making yourself SMART goals as you begin to implement the advice)

recIYebJ7fcTr8M3e.Name: Overview 1.4
recIYebJ7fcTr8M3e.Bottom Body:
**Your daytime activities affect your sleep**

Daytime activities, such as exercising or substance use, can have a huge impact on your sleep.

Aim for at least 20 minutes of daily exercise to reduce stress, improve your health, and help you sleep better! You may have to keep vigorous exercise to daytime hours so it doesn’t disrupt your sleep!

Avoid substances that can disrupt your sleep too close to bedtime. No caffeine after 2 pm and no alcohol at least 3 hours before bed!

recIi8Qgr7dYZIgtC.Name: Quickwin 9.2
recIi8Qgr7dYZIgtC.Bottom Body:
**Positive affirmations!**

Positive affirmations are a powerful tool that capitalizes on your brain’s neuroplasticity. 

That’s just a fancy term to say that it optimizes the way your brain builds new pathways. 

They are a powerful tool for shifting your mindset, crushing goals, and just feeling better overall!

Let’s look at how they work...

recIwFNYXOkP03uw6.Name: Tracking 1.3
recIwFNYXOkP03uw6.Bottom Body:
**How do you pick a tracker?**

Here are some of the key measurements you need from your wearable to help you monitor sleep:

- **Movement:** Most devices use actigraphy (continuous measurement of activity) to measure movement with an accelerometer. Measures: Daily activity levels and sleep-wake cycles.

- **Biometrics:** At a minimum, you should get a device that measures your heart rate. Measures: Sleep, health, recovery, and stress levels.

recIxXhXKqM77WY5y.Name: change 1.2
recIxXhXKqM77WY5y.Bottom Body:
Roadblocks to behavior change
1. **Ability**
2. **Scope**
3. **Consistency**
4. **Accountability/Support**

Let's take a closer look at each one and give you a few tips on how to overcome these roadblocks!

recIygRxK8bHiQtYt.Name: boostnight 1.1
recIygRxK8bHiQtYt.Bottom Body:
You now have some awesome tips for improving your sleep by boosting mornings and daytime activities, but, what about the night?

It's probably not a big surprise to learn that there are many things you can do at night to improve your sleep. 

**I'm too tired to be disciplined**
Implementing habits in the evening is sometimes the most difficult. This is due to your end-of-day mental fatigue.

recJ1DaDkZntgUdSG.Name: Orientation 2.1
recJ1DaDkZntgUdSG.Bottom Body:
Welcome to Reboot Camp week numero two!

After this week you will earn your reboot badge, meaning that you’ll be ready to start diving headfirst into more advanced sleep stuff. 

After last week, you’ve established the most basic of your foundation for good sleep, and this week we’re going to dig a little deeper!

Are you ready?

REBOOT CAMP WEEK 2: COMMENCE!

recJ2dBCB38Xo4sWh.Name: quickwins 5.3
recJ2dBCB38Xo4sWh.Bottom Body:
Let's say you currently watch TV before sleep. You have determined that it helps you unwind and relax.

**The problem?** TV before sleep can interfere with your quality of sleep and develop unwanted associations between your bed and nonsleep activities. 

**The fix?** Replace it with something else you enjoy that is relaxing and helpful to sleep. You can try reading instead! Make it fun and pick some books that really bring you joy. Audiobooks or podcasts are other great options.

Swapping habits may come with a little discomfort at first (change is never easy), but it is an excellent strategy for building routines that move you toward your goals.

recJEHfKXBMqPyuvA.Name: Needs 1.3
recJEHfKXBMqPyuvA.Bottom Body:
**Growing pains**
As you begin to master the foundations of better sleep, you'll also learn to deal with the unhelpful thoughts and feelings that accompany sleep problems. 

You may also find that some changes feel disruptive to your sleep. 

**Think of it like this:** When you try a new exercise you get sore. The more you do that exercise – the less sore you feel (and you get better at it).  

**Little sacrifices for long-term gains**
New sleep habits can leave you more tired at first but after you adjust, you'll see improvements in the quality and quantity of sleep you get. 

As you climb that competence ladder, you'll get better sleep with less effort!

recJKALPFAK5QDXQl.Name: Quickwin 7.1
recJKALPFAK5QDXQl.Bottom Body:
Are you ready for another quick win? In case you forgot, quick wins are small habits that bring big results! 

Not only will they help you improve your sleep, but they'll also help you with habit building!

Let's get that quick win...

recJT96NCnYdNfEQS.Name: BoostMorning 1.1
recJT96NCnYdNfEQS.Bottom Body:
To get things started with Reboot camp, let's talk about mornings. 

Mornings are an important part of your reboot. 

**Why?** By following a few simple rules, you can use your mornings to:
- Reset your circadian rhythm
- Boost happiness and productivity
- Optimize your body's internal clocks

Let's take a look at how to boost your mornings in a way that improves your sleep!

recJUkXBDkfC3XTuv.Name: Quickwin 13.3
recJUkXBDkfC3XTuv.Bottom Body:
This type of deep meditation can be done live or even with recorded audio that will instruct you to slowly **descend into your sleep stages while still being consciously aware of your thoughts**. 

Yoga Nidra sessions induce delta brain waves (similar to when you are asleep) which are associated with restoration and healing.

Yoga Nidra is not traditionally used as a way to fall asleep but rather to replenish our bodies when we’re sleep-deprived. However, many practices have now been tailored to induce sleep by leaving participants in a relaxed state rather than guiding them back to alertness at the end of a session. 

You can use Yoga Nidra for restoration or for sleep! The choice is yours.

Let’s see how to do it...

recJUvRe3T9RymXtu.Name: Substances 1.8
recJUvRe3T9RymXtu.Bottom Body:
Fortunately, you can still enjoy alcohol and good sleep too! 

**Just follow these rules:**

- Have your last drink of alcohol at least 3 hours before you want to be sleeping.
- Hydrate, hydrate, hydrate! Experts recommend that you drink one glass of water for every serving of alcohol.
- Swap out for a non-alcoholic beer at night! Believe it or not, hops can help you sleep better and you won’t get the negative side effects of alcohol.

**Knowledge is power**
If drinking is something you enjoy, we'll be back with some more tips on how to incorporate alcohol into your life and still get great sleep. 

**Substances and sleep**
There are many substances that impact sleep. Learning how to time substance use to reduce its impact on your sleep is the first step towards better sleep. 

We know change can be hard, so just do the best that you can and we’ll be here cheering on every one of your victories!

recJaKbRy1EeoI0lq.Name: goalqual 1.3
recJaKbRy1EeoI0lq.Bottom Body:
**2. Add noise**
Adding noise to your sleep may sound a little counterintuitive, right? Let's explore:

Environmental noise during the night is disruptive to sleep. Even if you aren't waking up, research has shown that it can still disrupt the quality of sleep you get. 

One of the best ways to combat environmental noise while improving your sleep stability is a noise machine! Pink noise (such as rain falling and waves rolling in) has been shown to increase sleep stability. 

Many people also find that soothing white noise and nature sounds help them fall asleep faster and maintain a higher quality of sleep. 

So, if you're looking to boost sleep quality – try a noise machine!

recJbIQckuNacpunU.Name: Sleepdrive 1.5
recJbIQckuNacpunU.Bottom Body:
The sleep dynamic duo is not finished when you’re sleeping, though! They’re still hard at work.

Your sleep drive declines rapidly during the first half of your night. But, fortunately, your circadian rhythm makes sure that the circadian alerting system stays quiet and you remain in sleep mode.

As you recall, your circadian rhythm relies on cues like darkness to keep this sleep mode thing going. That’s why light is so disruptive to sleep!

recJgXlkta4v0MK8F.Name: Bedroom 1.7
recJgXlkta4v0MK8F.Bottom Body:
**No laptops either!**

You thought you found a loophole, didn’t you? Laptops also give off blue light and train your mind that bed is also for activities other than sex and sleep. 

Doing work or checking emails on your laptop from bed is an especially big no-no as it can be very emotionally stimulating and make it hard to sleep.

recK2Ql5MFWCGxTWu.Name: worry 1.1
recK2Ql5MFWCGxTWu.Bottom Body:
**So, you’re in a relationship with sleep – and it’s complicated**. 

You now understand why having sleep problems can lead to dramatic and anxious thoughts. 

But, what impact does that have on your sleep? 

A pretty big one. The more time we spend in bed struggling with sleep, the more stress and anxiety impacts our ability to sleep. 

One of the main reasons is due to **Subconscious Sleep Stress.**

recK3CifPRJFJu5xe.Name: Onboarding 1.4
recK3CifPRJFJu5xe.Bottom Body:
**2. Sleep Drive**
Your circadian rhythm syncs up with its buddy **sleep drive** to produce a **healthy sleep-wake cycle**. 

**What is it?** Your sleep drive is your body’s **Need for Sleep** (No, it doesn’t star Vin Diesel). 

**How does it work?** When you’re awake, a chemical called _adenosine_ builds in your brain and creates **sleep pressure.** The longer you are awake, the more pressure builds which creates your need for sleep.

Every time you sleep, the whole process gets reset and begins again the next day. 

When all is aligned, sleep pressure peaks just as your circadian rhythm stops sending alert signals and starts sending its sleep signals. The result? Zzzzzzzzzzzz

recKFcVA6hjek9iV7.Name: Sleep Basics 101 Overview 1.6
recKFcVA6hjek9iV7.Bottom Body:
That’s the basics of sleep science! Isn’t it exciting to learn about all of the things that make up your sleep?!

And if you ever find yourself being quizzed, you’ll have all of the information you need to put that quiz to bed!

Speaking of quizzes...

recKJoorKHNaKLDU2.Name: Elimhabits 1.3
recKJoorKHNaKLDU2.Bottom Body:
**2. Swap it out**

It will take some discipline to reduce electronics before bed. One great way to approach it is to swap it out. If your habit is watching TV from bed, try listening to a podcast instead. 

If you like scrolling on your phone before bed, try journaling about your day, reading a fun book, or even doing a crossword puzzle.

Finding relaxing ways to unwind is possible. It may take some adjusting and discomfort, but the improvements in your sleep will be worth it!

recKXSjeLSHteCj7X.Name: Overview 1.1
recKXSjeLSHteCj7X.Bottom Body:
You did it! You made it through the first week of Reboot Camp and we are **so proud** of you! Pat yourself on the back (we’d do it for you but we haven’t figured out that feature on the app yet)

We threw a TON of information at you this week so let’s take a little time to review what we’ve covered so far!

**This week you learned about:**

- **How to build a strong foundation for change**
- **How a morning ritual can change your life**
- **How your daytime activities affect your sleep**
- **How a bedtime routine can help you fall asleep faster**

Let’s quickly recap what you learned.

recKi6nSlqsQnDlBh.Name: Decompression 1.1
recKi6nSlqsQnDlBh.Bottom Body:
Now that you understand how blue light messes with sleep, you may see why it’s a bad idea to “decompress” using electronics.

**But, unwinding at the end of the day is essential, right?** 
A bedtime routine might be able to help with that!

Bedtime routines are one of the most important things you can do to decompress at the end of the day and get your mind and body ready for sleep.

As a bonus, it will also improve your sleep quality **and** your happiness (more on the science behind the happiness boosting qualities of a bedtime routine later)

recL3OC69AwCy4rKO.Name: caffeineSleep 1.4
recL3OC69AwCy4rKO.Bottom Body:
Before we give you the Rested Rules of caffeine consumption, let's look at why caffeine is such a popular stimulant (and why it's not great for sleep):

- It pumps you up by boosting adrenaline (activating your fight-or-flight response)
- It reduces melatonin. 
- It blocks an important sleep regulator called adenosine (Adenosine slowly builds up in your brain over the day creating sleep pressure which is your body's need for sleep)
- You can't build up a tolerance to the sleep-disrupting effects of caffeine. Even if you **feel** less stimulated, the negative impacts on sleep only intensify with increasing doses of caffeine. 

OK, so how do you enjoy your caffeine without it impacting your sleep?

recL7N08ieBDk61aQ.Name: BasicsQ 1.1
recL7N08ieBDk61aQ.Bottom Body:
Wow, you've really learned a lot! Don't worry, you don't need to memorize all of your learnings, we'll keep reminding you of all the most important stuff. 

However, we do want you to remember some key facts! 

ARE YOU READY TO SHOW US WHAT YOU LEARNED?? ARE YOU? (sorry for yelling, we get really excited about quizzes)

Let's go!

recLCfjUHrSaMc60x.Name: Sleepstress 1.1
recLCfjUHrSaMc60x.Bottom Body:
**So, you’re in a relationship with sleep – and it’s complicated.** 

The unfortunate reality is that sleep is an essential need and our brains tend to panic over essential needs. 

This can lead to unhelpful automatic thought patterns that put the stress in sleep. 

If you've ever tossed and turned at night while cursing the sky, you are familiar with why sleep and stress don't mix well.
recLCfjUHrSaMc60x.Top Body: ## You can control your relationship with sleep

recLSLbCvvWkk1AHe.Name: worry 1.5
recLSLbCvvWkk1AHe.Bottom Body:
That means- you don’t have to worry about sleep. 

- We’ll help you better understand _your_ problems.
- We’ll tackle subconscious sleep anxiety.
- We’ll show you how to reprogram your brain for better sleep. 
- We’ll teach you how to get the sleep you deserve. 

Let us take the stress out of sleep.

recLVtYRxtmCWLQYB.Name: Importance 1.3
recLVtYRxtmCWLQYB.Bottom Body:
**Get started**
Rule numero uno, and we’re going to remind you of this often:

**Your bedroom should only be for sleep** (and sex). Seriously. 

By participating in any other activities in your bedroom, your mind begins to make associations between your bedroom and wakefulness/alertness/stress/work/true crime documentaries.

You want your mind to **only associate your bed and bedroom with sleep**.

recLXsz8f9WTUHADi.Name: Quickwin 9.3
recLXsz8f9WTUHADi.Bottom Body:
**How to do positive affirmations**
There are many ways you can use positive affirmations. Let’s just focus on how to use them for crushing your sleep goals!

Each day, choose a habit you already have and add positive affirmations to it. For instance, after your brush your teeth? Look in the mirror and say your positive affirmations. 

You should choose a phrase that boosts you and helps you overcome an area that you’re struggling with.

Let’s look at some examples...

recLYqt6itTjUAO59.Name: Waketime 1.1
recLYqt6itTjUAO59.Bottom Body:
Waking up is the very first thing you’ll do every morning, so it’s kind of important that you get it right.

With that being said – we’re going to teach you the golden rule of mornings!

\*cue dramatic horn intro music\*

**Wake up at the same time every day**

This is one of those tips we’ll repeat over and over. It is a tip that can be life changing for many people. 

**But, why is it so important?**

recLaTRCU0oT7qpUh.Name: Trackingprogress 1.4
recLaTRCU0oT7qpUh.Bottom Body:
**Should everyone track their sleep?**
Nope! If you find that tracking your sleep leads you to feel more stressed about sleep, you can skip it. 

Tracking is a powerful accountability tool, but it isn't your only tool. 

You may choose to track how Rested you feel each morning, your productivity, or your general well-being. 

We always want you to figure out what works for you! 

Try tracking your sleep for a week and see how it goes!

recLeQqHB1KY6eRov.Name: Sleep Basics 101 Overview 1.1
recLeQqHB1KY6eRov.Bottom Body:
Believe it or not, you now have all of the sleep basics you’ll need to start your REBOOT. 

I know we pumped you with all kinds of sleep science, so let’s take a quick minute to go over those concepts so that when we bring them up again you’ll know exactly what we’re talking about!

Let’s review!

recMDTZz9pL3PRNi6.Name: Onboarding1.1
recMDTZz9pL3PRNi6.Bottom Body:
**Welcome to Reboot Camp!**

You’ve learned the basics of habit mastery and the importance of learning by association (and why it complicates sleep). Now, it’s time to reboot your relationship with sleep! 

We’ll start by teaching you the basic science that goes into your sleep (forget street smarts, we’re all about sleep smarts!)

recMDTZz9pL3PRNi6.Next Button: Get ready! Get set! Get Rested!

DUDE! You just did that thang.
