## 2. Your Sleep Library 
Your sleep library is a bank of sleep knowledge at your fingertips. It contains the latest and greatest research, tips, and solutions for sleep problems. 

Whenever you have questions about sleep – search for answers in your sleep library!

We will constantly update the library with the newest research, facts, and helpful articles. 

If you're unable to find answers in your library – hit up your sleep coach!

recgkrbYYdkKsfFSl.Name: Quickwin 7.2
recgkrbYYdkKsfFSl.Bottom Body:
Did you know that any time you feel stressed you can calm your body down nearly instantly by engaging in diaphragmatic breathing?

It can also boost how efficiently you breathe! It's super effective for people with asthma or lung disorders to help improve their lung elasticity. Cool, right?

**What is diaphragmatic breathing?**
Diaphragmatic breathing, or belly breathing, means you fully engage your stomach muscles while taking deep breaths.

This style of breathing activates your parasympathetic nervous system which sends signals to your body to calm down!

You can do it any time and anywhere!

recgrimOIdBydZuuq.Name: Intro 0.5
recgrimOIdBydZuuq.Bottom Body:
We're different because we are offering a complete tool kit at your fingertips. 

We **aren't** selling quick fixes or temporary solutions. **We want to teach you how to take back control of your sleep**. 

By implementing techniques from sleep therapists, psychologists, and health experts – together we can rebuild your relationship with sleep! 

Are you ready to feel Rested?

rech0MiPdSyn0N7XI.Name: Elimhabits 1.2
rech0MiPdSyn0N7XI.Bottom Body:
**1. Get alarmed** 

Alarms aren't just for mornings! Try setting an alarm an hour before your regular bedtime. Once the alarm goes off, it's time to powerdown all of your electronics. That means: no more TV, no laptop, and no scrolling on your phone.

Once your alarm goes off for bed, powerdown and engage in a bedtime ritual. You can try reading, listening to audiobooks, yoga, and even treat yourself to a little skincare routine.

We'll give you more guidance on how to build an awesome bedtime routine later. For now, try practicing an alarm for bed this week and see how setting a clear boundary makes things a bit easier!

rechK0ydA3TaLfUuW.Name: QuickWinFA 10.4
rechK0ydA3TaLfUuW.Bottom Body:
This method is designed to change your attitude about sleep. It's specifically for people who "try" to sleep. 

Instead of trying to sleep, you're going to act like a kid who gets to stay up late and do all the fun things!

With some practice, you'll be able to turn the tables on your sleep stress and prove you don't even care!

**Won't I be tired the next day? **It's possible, but you're also tired on those nights you're trying to sleep and can't find it. You'll recover!

Rebooting your sleep habits may require some days with fatigue, just lighten your schedule if it's overwhelming.

rechObKVwlj6fwBGh.Name: spower 1.8
rechObKVwlj6fwBGh.Bottom Body:
As you begin to gain mastery over your sleep, keep in mind that the incredible benefits that sleep has to offer are compounding. 

**What does that mean?**
Just like how a good investment keeps gaining interest, good sleep gives you benefits that rollover. 

**In it for the long haul**
That's why we want you to focus on the long-term. As you complete our program, you'll gain skills that help you better understand your relationship with sleep and how to reboot it. 

These changes may be hard at first but the long-term payoff is worth it! 

**Are you ready to gain superpowers?**

They use sensors to detect physiological signs like heart rate, body temperature, oxygen levels, and smart rings also measure movement. 

**Popular finger wearables:**
- **Smart Rings** (Oura, ORII, Go2Sleep, Motiv)
- **Rings and Fingertip monitors** (Wellue, Biolight) 

**Pros:** Smart rings are stylish and discrete with many cool features!

rechzZjmAg152DvGz.Name: goalsleepschedule1.3
rechzZjmAg152DvGz.Bottom Body:
**2. Don't nap**

Napping can be a great tool, but it's not helpful when you're trying to get your sleep schedule on track. 

**Sleep drive**
During the day there's a chemical that builds up in your brain called adenosine. As the levels increase, it leads us to feel more and more sleep pressure until we finally succumb to sleep. This is called your sleep drive! 

Here's the kicker – sleep is the only thing that clears it. This is one of the reasons that naps can really disrupt your sleep schedule. They can make it harder to fall asleep at night due to the reduced sleep drive! 

So, skip your naps if you want to get your schedule on track!

reci0EPQi1tH36oFd.Name: Quickwin 13.1
reci0EPQi1tH36oFd.Bottom Body:
What time is it?

It’s Quick Win time!

This quick win is going to focus on the theme of decompression. 

You can even make it a part of your power down hour! This technique has been dubbed “conscious sleep” and people are now adapting it to actually help you fall asleep!

What is it?

reciF3pVW43wZDKed.Name: unlearn 1.6
reciF3pVW43wZDKed.Bottom Body:
One of the joys of being human is that at our core, we are still animals. That is to say, we are trainable (although fairly stubborn).

In order to unlearn how to sleep poorly, you need to reboot your relationship with sleep.

That means weakening the unhelpful associations and strengthening the association between bed + sleep. 

How? Let us show you the way...

reciPOZ8ygg9D2Utq.Name: sneaky 1.6
reciPOZ8ygg9D2Utq.Bottom Body:
**Nicotine and sleep**

Nicotine is a stimulant, so it's no surprise it has a negative impact on sleep. 

Nicotine impacts your sleep by:
- Causing fragmented sleep patterns
- Reduction in REM sleep
- Triggering insomnia
- Increases snoring and sleep apnea

People who use a lot of nicotine may even experience withdrawal during the night, leading to poorer sleep quality. 

**TIPS:**
- Avoid nicotine within 4 hours of bedtime
- Try gradually cutting down on your intake using patches, nasal sprays, or any other controlled dosage.

reciWI3b8ycobHhtZ.Name: QuickwinFA 1.4
reciWI3b8ycobHhtZ.Bottom Body:
It's sounds wrong, but it's right!

As your skin is exposed to hot water, it increases blood flow to the surface of the skin. 

This results in heat loss through your skin (especially your hands and feet) and a lowering in your core body temperature. 

Research has found that even just a 10 minute bathing session is enough to gain the sleep-inducing benefits!

You can also try warm socks or a hot water bottle on your feet! It has a similar effect.

recigF8YuMq6BJOfB.Name: Quickwin 14.4

Understanding how your mind works makes it easier to adopt habits that move you closer to your goals (with minimal effort).

Today’s Quick Win is an easy-to-use tool that only takes a couple of minutes of your time (maximum!). It can help you fall asleep more quickly all while programming your brain for positive thinking.

recikpZxH1UX6rWnD.Name: QuickwinFA 8.2
recikpZxH1UX6rWnD.Bottom Body:
**First, what’s a grounding technique?**
In case you forgot, grounding techniques are tools that activate the senses and help pull your brain out of unhelpful automatic thought patterns, loops, or rumination. They are great tools when your mind won’t shut off. 

There are so many different grounding techniques, and we’ll show you all the best ones for sleep!

You learned about making lists earlier, now let’s introduce you to your next grounding technique for sleep!

reciqERUyXH3vCaW1.Name: Overview 2.3
reciqERUyXH3vCaW1.Bottom Body:
**How your brain processes your sleep environment **

In addition to keeping your sleep sanctuary dark, it’s also a good idea to start **dimming the lights an hour before bedtime **to induce relaxation.

Also, use **motion-sensor night lights** to help guide you during bathroom breaks or any other disruptions. 

And your sleep sanctuary doesn’t just love darkness, it also loves **quiet**.

**Your brain processes noise while you sleep**, even if it’s not loud enough to wake you up!

Have **earplugs** handy or invest in a **sound machine** to eliminate environmental noise so it doesn’t mess with your deep restorative sleep!

recivE9g02oPaCfPy.Name: QuickwinFA 6.1
recivE9g02oPaCfPy.Bottom Body:
It’s time for your very first Reboot Camp Quick Win!

This tip is great because it is going to be helpful for starting your day off right and can also help you to fall asleep faster at bedtime too!

And it’s SO simple.

Ready to find out what it is?

recj8D6zgsQrDb3mB.Name: Elimhabits 1.4
recj8D6zgsQrDb3mB.Bottom Body:
We'll continue to give you more great tips about how to make changes and stick with them. 

For now, try out setting an alarm for bed this week and swapping out your digital devices or TV habit for something that's still enjoyable but also helpful to sleep.

recjBpMANisCqLAT2.Name: Hydration 1.2
recjBpMANisCqLAT2.Bottom Body:
We say “adequate” because there is such a thing as too much water. 

**Too much water on sleep**

Drinking too much water before bed can lead to **more bathroom trips** throughout your night, leading to a disrupted sleep cycle and lost sleep.

Waking up to pee is sad, but the thing you should be really afraid of is **dehydration** 

\*cue even more intense ominous music\*

You'll likely be surprised to find that there are many saunas available in community centers, gyms, and even hotels that you can access.

recjmJHOpi50R1v5l.Name: QuickwinFA 11.3
recjmJHOpi50R1v5l.Bottom Body:
**Decluttering tips!**

- **Make time**: Set a specific time to spend 10 minutes cleaning up your room each day. You can make it fun by blasting your favorite music as you work.

- **Baskets and bins**: In a bind, you may sometimes have to resort to using baskets and bins to store clutter. It’s not ideal but it does allow you to declutter a room in record time. So, grab some decorative baskets or bins to do a quick tidy in a bind!

A neat room induces immediate unconscious relaxation, which can help you **fall asleep faster**!

Now back to Reboot Camp!

recjnFPMLnlDKQ8JD.Name: getRidStress 1.1
recjnFPMLnlDKQ8JD.Bottom Body:
**Stress management 101**
You've now learned why stress is so problematic to sleep. 

In fact, too much stress is problematic to every single area of your health. 

Learning how to better manage your stress can improve every area of functioning. We want to help you by focusing in on what's causing you the most problems currently.

recjrrACz3L4IGh7O.Name: Exercise 1.7
recjrrACz3L4IGh7O.Bottom Body:
Ok, so now you have an idea of how powerful exercise is as a tool for boosting sleep.

Remember, you don't have to become an Olympic athlete overnight. The key is to find something you enjoy and stick with it. 

Now let’s take a look at some other daytime activities that may be impacting your sleep...

recjyjo1PXAVYpzTT.Name: Hydration 1.1
recjyjo1PXAVYpzTT.Bottom Body:
Are you thirsty for better sleep? 

Water is extremely important for your overall health. You would literally die without water 

\*cue ominous music\*

Adequate hydration is necessary to keep all your bodily functions working at top-notch and is known for **improving sleep**.

reck41aSXP9vT8gZz.Name: Importance 1.1
reck41aSXP9vT8gZz.Bottom Body:
Today we’re going to talk about your bedroom, also known as – your sleep sanctuary!

It has a ring to it, right?

**The room where you sleep**
Your sleep environment is _so important _for your overall quality of sleep. 

Thinking of your bedroom as a **sleep sanctuary** is the first step in creating a safe, cozy, and comfortable space to whisk you off into la-la land

So let’s talk about why a sleep sanctuary is important and how you can turn your bedroom into the gosh darn sleep sanctuary that you deserve!

reckLhg9OymUVq1u4.Name: Hydration 1.4
reckLhg9OymUVq1u4.Bottom Body:
Your body performs important maintenance on every cell while you sleep.

**Every single action requires water**. 

Therefore, sleeping dehydrated keeps your body from performing it’s activities optimally which can impair these very important processes such as forming memories, processing emotions, boosting your immune system, and clearing away waste. 

So, is it possible to hydrate your way to a better sleep?

reckOKEUCZNQYC7BR.Name: Science 1.4
reckOKEUCZNQYC7BR.Bottom Body:
One of the most effective ways of optimizing sleep architecture is by doing aerobic exercise during the day. 

**How much exercise?**
Doing at least 20 minutes of cardiovascular activity like swimming or jogging has been shown to significantly increase the amount of time you spend in restorative deep sleep. 

Deep sleep is when your growth hormone levels peak. This makes your skin glow, builds muscle, burns fat, and more. 

Growth hormone levels decrease with age, which means the amount we get during sleep becomes increasingly important and beneficial. 

Deep sleep also naturally decreases as we age, so, boosting it with exercise can offer exceptional health benefits as we get older.

Cool, right?

reckTBCwN0q0aEPjI.Name: Overview 2.2
reckTBCwN0q0aEPjI.Bottom Body:
**Why build yourself a sleep sanctuary?**

Creating an environment that’s relaxing and inviting can actually give you a better quality of sleep.

**How to build yourself a sleep sanctuary?**
1. Never forget the number one rule: **Your sleep sanctuary should only be for sleep (or sex)**
2. Keep your sleep sanctuary **dark** by using **blackout curtains** or a **sleep mask**
3. Keep **ALL** **electronics out **of the bedroom
4. **Buy moisture-wicking sheets **such as **cotton, silk, or bamboo** fabrics.
5. **Set your thermostat to 65℉ (18.3℃) **for a cooler and better quality sleep** **

reckdIsMLwU6T6nwG.Name: Intro 0.3
reckdIsMLwU6T6nwG.Bottom Body:
**Sleep deprivation:**

- Lowers your immunity
- Makes it harder to lose weight and build muscle
- Increases your risk of chronic disease and cancer
- Disrupts your emotions
- Worsens pain
- Interferes with learning
- AND MORE...
reckdIsMLwU6T6nwG.Next Button: What can we do about it?

reckjGGohzZQFxoWo.Name: Hydration 1.3
reckjGGohzZQFxoWo.Bottom Body:
Dehydration doesn’t just impair your function during the day, it can be super disruptive to sleep and cause other issues like:

- Snoring
- High blood pressure
- Dry mouth
- Charley horse (you know that cramping feeling in your muscles?)
- Reduced melatonin

Not only that, but it causes less restoration during sleep!

reckjbzyNGumBCwEj.Name: Quickwin 7.3
reckjbzyNGumBCwEj.Bottom Body:
**How to do diaphragmatic breathing**

Simply sit or lay down somewhere comfortable and do the following:
- **Relax your shoulders**
- **Put one hand on your chest and one hand on your stomach**
- **Inhale:** Slowly inhale through your nose for the count of 3, You should feel your belly push out while your chest remains relatively still
- **Exhale**: Purse your lips, press gently on your stomach and exhale slowly for about 3 seconds 
- **Repeat**

It may take a bit of practice to get this down, but it's an incredible breathing technique that is foundational to all other types of breathwork. 

Try it tonight before bed (or any time you feel stressed) and notice how calming this practice can be

Repeat it four times to get started. As you get better you can do it for longer!

recl1Xuwtl0mSkV6m.Name: Quickwin 8.4
recl1Xuwtl0mSkV6m.Bottom Body:
Try box breathing before bed tonight to induce relaxation!

Breathing techniques are fantastic skills to have in your little toolbox.

Being able to send your body into a calmer state will also allow you to think more clearly and feel more in control.

Remember that it may be difficult at first, and that’s normal! Practicing breathing techniques will make you more efficient at breathing.

Ok, now back to our Reboot Camp journey!

recl7EswYdfDd70fL.Name: BedtimeBasics 1.8
recl7EswYdfDd70fL.Bottom Body:
**Set your thermostat to 65℉ (18.3℃)** for a cooler and better quality sleep.

Keep in mind that other factors can have an impact on your room’s temperature. It can take some trial and error to find what works for you but start cooler since your body needs to be cool for quality sleep. 

You can also stack your strategies, by wearing moisture-wicking fabrics to help better regulate your temperature during sleep and minimizing blankets. 

Heck, sleep in the buff even, just stay cool!

reclAmf60RyNI9LIu.Name: Tracking 2.3
reclAmf60RyNI9LIu.Bottom Body:
**Awareness is power**

You’ll actually be quite surprised at how much you can learn from a sleep diary. Sleep diaries create awareness of daily patterns, habits, and activities that impact sleep. 

Occasionally, you’ll discover unexpected things that help or hinder your slumber.

There are other benefits to sleep diaries as well...

reclWu8ZNjJ4DQqMa.Name: goalfallasleepfaster1.1
reclWu8ZNjJ4DQqMa.Bottom Body:
We want to help you reach your goal of falling asleep faster. 

**Defining your goal**
When everything is aligned, you should be able to fall asleep in less than 20 minutes. It can take some time to get there, but it is possible.

To get you started, we're going to talk about two things you can do to help you fall asleep faster!

1. **Wake up at the same time every morning** 
2. **Only go to bed when you are tired**

reclYnExZV51ptE3G.Name: Tracking 1.4
reclYnExZV51ptE3G.Bottom Body:
**What else can wearables measure?**
Here are some of the advanced measurements you can get with wearables:

- Body temperature
- Electrocardiogram (ECG)
- Blood oxygen levels (SPO2)
- Noise

These measurements can be helpful to monitor for snoring, sleep apnea, sleep cycles, heart health, and more. 

Let's explore how they measure sleep!

recla1Evnv2G6KMcw.Name: QuickwinFA 9.2
recla1Evnv2G6KMcw.Bottom Body:
**Positive Affirmations!**
You may have already heard of positive affirmations. They’re a popular tool for people seeking a boost to their self-esteem, motivation, or those who just want to harness the power of positivity. 

But, did you know they can be used for sleep?

Positive affirmations in the comfort of your own bed are a great way to retrain your thought patterns before bed. 

They can help untick you from negative thought loops and even induce some feel-good relaxation. 

Let’s look at how to do them...

recldYDD1OrKHmqes.Name: BasicsQ 1.15
recldYDD1OrKHmqes.Bottom Body:
Great job! Completing these quizzes will help you review some of the important learnings you've gained. Reviewing helps with memory consolidation! 

Now that you've completed Sleep 101: The Basics it's time to take a deeper dive into some of these fundamental topics. 

We'll explore all kinds of things that impact your sleep and learn how to combat them.

reclmNetkuwDhxzUJ.Name: intro 0.0
reclmNetkuwDhxzUJ.Bottom Body:
We're so happy you've joined us. You've taken a vital first step toward improving your sleep. Congrats!

**Now, It's time to begin your very first journey**

These journeys are where you'll learn how to reboot your relationship with sleep. Think of journeys as that course on sleep you wish someone taught you before your sleep got so complicated. 

**Your journey toward better sleep**

As you complete each journey, you'll learn about:
- The incredible benefits of sleep
- Why sleep gets disrupted 
- How to work with your body's natural rhythms to master your sleep!

But first, let's talk a little about why sleep is so important...

reclwB77FIvvYlKf2.Name: Exercise 1.6
reclwB77FIvvYlKf2.Bottom Body:
So, aim for at least 20 minutes of daily exercise to reduce stress, improve your health, and help you sleep better!

You can try walking, jogging, swimming, biking, yoga, pilates, or even running in place. The point is to get your body moving, use those muscles, and get your heart rate up. 

TIP: Keep the vigorous exercise to daytime hours if you find it energizes you too much before bed.

Remember, it’s fine to start small. 

**Something is better than nothing** when it comes to exercise.

recm6b8FcapnH8a2v.Name: QuickwinFA 14.3
recm6b8FcapnH8a2v.Bottom Body:
**Smart Alarms**

Smart alarms track your sleep cycles and use that information to intelligently wake you up when you are in a lighter stage of sleep!

They select the best time within your set window of an ideal wake-up time!

They are available in various app forms and through many wearable devices like smartwatches. 

You may already have the feature available if you own a wearable!

Users of smart alarms report that they wake up easier and have less mornings where they feel the weight of grogginess looming over them. 

See? It’s about working smarter not harder!

recm9LOeeqBorFyKo.Name: quickwins 5.1
recm9LOeeqBorFyKo.Bottom Body:
iiiiiiiiiiiiiiit's Quick Win time! 

Today's quick win is all about making your life easier (doesn't that sound nice?)

As you learn more about how certain habits you have may be negatively impacting your sleep, you'll be making changes. 

But, what do you do when you're faced with ending a habit that brings you joy and comfort (even if it is unhealthy)...

recmGeMoxGBFrlNLe.Name: Trackingprogress 1.2
recmGeMoxGBFrlNLe.Bottom Body:
**How do I make a sleep diary?**
Use a journal, an app, or make notes on your phone. Sleep diaries give insights into what affects your sleep and you can also use them to track your progress on certain goals! For instance, you can check a box every morning you make your bed this week!

**What to track in your sleep diary**
Sleep:
1. Sleep and wake times 
2. Awakenings during the night and why
3. Notes on any difficulties falling back asleep

Optional- Habits/environment:
- Medications, drugs, or substances used that day
- Naps
- Mood/energy

You may also want to track things like the time of your last meal, exercise, and other factors. 

Start simple and view it as a tool to help you keep on track.

recmIcypsLLu8Jf4T.Name: Tracking 2.6
recmIcypsLLu8Jf4T.Bottom Body:
**Get started**

Starting out, try to keep a sleep diary for at least **2 weeks**. This will give you a good idea of how certain activities impact your snoozefest. 

If keeping a sleep diary makes you feel obsessive or too stressed about your sleep– it’s ok to skip it. It’s a helpful tool, but it’s not the only helpful tool.

recmKhF2vnQB2iYHK.Name: quickwinFA 5.2
recmKhF2vnQB2iYHK.Bottom Body:
One excellent technique is **journaling**. 

Don’t be intimidated by the idea of writing, you’ll use your journal simply as an outlet for your mind. Pretend it’s a friend that you can dump your random thoughts and anxiety unto. You can even give it a name. 

Journaling is a very effective and scientifically supported way to reduce stress. It can also be pretty fun (and cathartic). 

**How do I start?**

recmMRhWbU5XdlKqd.Name: quickwins 5.2
recmMRhWbU5XdlKqd.Bottom Body:
Meet our good friend – Habit Swapping!

**What is habit swapping?**
Habit swapping is another one of those little behavior hacks that makes it simpler to improve your life.

**Here's how to do it:**
1. Identify a habit that is unhelpful to your goals
2. Determine why you have that habit (i.e. it brings you comfort)
3. Replace it with a new habit that does the same thing but also brings you closer to your goals!

Let's look at an example...

recmMqD2C4KH80HY4.Name: to know you 1.2
recmMqD2C4KH80HY4.Top Body: We know it's just the beginning of your journey toward better sleep. We want to make sure you get the support you need!

recmOUmRinSxGrLMw.Name: spower 1.3
recmOUmRinSxGrLMw.Bottom Body:
**Sleep – your superpower**
Sleep is essential to function. Good sleep is essential to thrive.

There is nothing else quite as powerful as sleep when it comes to benefits to your mind, mood, and body. 

**Sleep – the ultimate supplement**
Let's take a closer look at each area of functioning and how sleep actually gives you superpowers...

recmUiSmDAorUE3s2.Name: Waketime 1.5
recmUiSmDAorUE3s2.Bottom Body:
**Instead of hitting snooze…**

Try and sit up in bed as soon as possible. 

Don’t grab your digital devices or lay down to rest your eyes. Sit up, think about something exciting you’ll do that day, and get ready to jump into your day!

Ok, maybe don’t jump, but definitely get out of bed.

If your snooze habits are on autopilot, put your alarm across the room and force yourself to get out of bed to relieve your suffering.

recmcUvDhF2vkCs3W.Name: Orientation 1.3
recmcUvDhF2vkCs3W.Bottom Body:
80% of great sleep is about the basics. The fundamentals. If it’s too basic….that’s GREAT! That just means that you’re AWESOME and will be even more set for success. 

More than likely some stuff is going to make you go “WHOA, I didn’t know that!” or “WOW, I actually thought the opposite was true.” 

And that, new friend, is what Rested Health is all about. Your credible, no malarky, sleep homey! (People say "malarky" still, right?)

Remember that you’ll absolutely get the most out of this program by starting at the bottom rung of the competence ladder. 

We’ll gradually make our way up to the top together!

**Are you pumped up to start learning about your relationship with sleep?**

recmgNFSdP7YfzeHY.Name: Intro 0.4
recmgNFSdP7YfzeHY.Bottom Body:
Most current "solutions" for sleep problems are nothing more than temporary fixes that make problems worse.

In order to truly change the way you sleep, **it's necessary to reboot and rebuild your relationship with sleep**. You deserve long-term results. 

Rested was built alongside **world-renowned sleep experts** to bring you a program that has never been made accessible to the general public. 

Even if you've already tried a lot of things – trust us, this is different.

recmn5gY1vbishJwl.Name: QuickwinFA2.1
recmn5gY1vbishJwl.Bottom Body:
**It's time for another Quick Win!**

Since you told us you want help falling asleep faster, we're going to focus on another tip that can help quiet your mind and ease you off to sleep!

**Are you ready?**

recn89pxQ71ojnwTU.Name: worry 1.4
recn89pxQ71ojnwTU.Bottom Body:
Subconscious sleep stress is a program that your brain created that isn't helpful. 

Just like all of the other unhelpful programs your brain has created, you can:
- Identify it
- Determine how to fix it
- Practice until you climb to the top of the competence ladder!
- Enjoy your new programming

You may be wondering how your brain and body create these "unhelpful" programs. We'll explore that in your next journey...

recncf6BESeNdfJns.Name: Sleepstress 1.6
recncf6BESeNdfJns.Bottom Body:
Throughout your journeys, you’ll learn how to better regulate your biological clock and keep it in tune with your sleep drive. This will help you feel in control of your relationship with sleep.

To do this, you’ll develop:
- Morning and evening rituals
- Environmental sleep cues
- Sleep schedules
- Sleep-promoting habits
- And more…

recniBtfnyByK9aqR.Name: Electronics 1.3
recniBtfnyByK9aqR.Bottom Body:
**Bed +📱+💻+📺**
Remember when we talked about conditioning? Using digital devices while in bed is one of the most common reasons your program for sleep gets complicated. 

Even if you aren’t using electronics from bed, using them before bed can still wreak havoc on your sleep.

**How?** 

Let's talk about blue light a moment. 

Have you ever noticed how looking up into a clear blue sky can feel energizing?

The main reason is due to the high-intensity blue light that comes from the sun. Blue light is a **short wavelength**, which means it produces higher amounts of energy than other types of light!

**But, what does this have to do with your electronics?**

recnkKA3gEOW3JnNx.Name: Grogginess 1.8
recnkKA3gEOW3JnNx.Bottom Body:
There you have it! Beat the groggies with these fun and basic Reboot Camp tips:

1. **Fake it til you make it**
2. **Try a Green Smoothie**
3. **Take a nap**
4. **Caffeine + L-Theanine**

That’s a wrap for this section.

Next, we’ll do a quick recap of what we’ve learned and test that knowledge with a little quiz!

We just know you’ll ace it, because you’re just that awesome and we give everyone A’s here at Rested Health. \*cue tears of pride\*

recnr1IEHvSSOnSkK.Name: Substances 1.2
recnr1IEHvSSOnSkK.Bottom Body:
**Caffeine** is used daily by people all over the world.

Some people quite literally cannot begin their day without that morning cup of joe, and it can be a great way to **increase alertness, elevate your mood, and improve focus!**

**Alcohol** is also a very popular substance because it is known to **relax inhibitions and reduce stress**. Some of it also tastes pretty good.

Sounds great, right? 

These substances _can_ make you feel really good, but they’re both known to be quite the little **sleep disruptors.**

Now, just know, we’d never ask you to quit your favorite substances. However, knowing how they impact your slumber can help you make decisions that will improve your sleep

Let’s explore...

recnvpDZv27jZIMiK.Name: Why Rested 1.2
recnvpDZv27jZIMiK.Bottom Body:
**The struggle is real**
We understand that losing out on sleep is stressful. 

We also understand that in order to get long-term results, you need to build a mastery of new habits.

**What is mastery?** 
That's when a habit becomes automatic. Automatic habits take up less brain space. 

**Change that's healthy**
We will focus on the most important habit changes based on your profile and quiz answers in order to create change that is:
- Manageable (we want you to succeed)
- Long-lasting
- Effective

It's time to reboot your relationship with sleep.

reco2wFfGgnqle5t6.Name: unlearn 1.1
reco2wFfGgnqle5t6.Bottom Body:
In the last journey, we learned that our brains can be rather dramatic and this (amongst other things) can lead to unhelpful programs that disrupt sleep. 

Now, we're going to talk a little more about how we can be reprogrammed! 

First of all, let's talk about classical conditioning. 

**So, what is classical conditioning?** Despite what the name says, it's not an orchestra with great hair.

Classical conditioning is learning by association! 

How does it happen?

reco78eljTa3jjAOY.Name: Orientation 2.4
reco78eljTa3jjAOY.Bottom Body:
**Be the tortoise not the hare**
And don’t forget! Reboot Camp isn’t a race. The most important thing is that you are learning techniques in a way that you can apply them to your life easily.

That means learning at whatever pace works the best for you. 

If you’re enjoying cruising through, that’s wonderful and you rock! If you enjoyed doing week 1 at a slower pace and want to keep that up for week 2, DO IT! You also rock!

reco95OwtBH3YsjOO.Name: Quickwin 11.2
reco95OwtBH3YsjOO.Bottom Body:
**Wake up with a Light Alarm!**

How amazing does it feel to wake up with the sun on your face? The warmth, the fresh feeling. Reboot Camp has already taught you how beneficial sunshine is for your morning.

But what if it could use the sunrise as an alarm clock? 

Enter: Light Alarms!

recoRwkiT1oslDBVi.Name: Hydration 1.6
recoRwkiT1oslDBVi.Bottom Body:
So to recap: 

Staying hydrated is important to ensure you maintain healthy sleep. 

Try implementing strategies into your daily and bedtime routines to ensure you are getting the benefits of hydration without it negatively impacting your sleep!

Now we journey onto learning about supplements that can help improve the quality of your sleep...

recoXUK1wrfLZyCe9.Name: Quickwin 13.4
recoXUK1wrfLZyCe9.Bottom Body:
Yoga Nidra is meant as a restful practice. That means you’ll be doing most of the work laying down in a comfortable position. 

To induce Yoga Nidra, you must listen to a set of instructions, similar to a guided meditation. So, select a recording from an app, online, or elsewhere. You can find free sessions for sleep from apps like Insight Timer. 

Once you’re in that cozy state-of-mind and you have your yoga nidra app ready, choose your recording and be prepared for relaxation.

The session will involve visualizing your body parts and letting yourself sink into the relaxation of yoga nidra until you become aware of your entire body.

Ahhhhhhhhhhh……….

recosjelbhLSfF0u3.Name: change 1.3
recosjelbhLSfF0u3.Bottom Body:
**Overestimating your own ability causes you to**:
- Miss out on important learning opportunities
- Set ineffective goals 
- Underestimate your own strengths and weaknesses

**How do I avoid it?**
By approaching every change from the position of an amateur, you'll be able to more honestly assess what needs to be done and the appropriate first steps to take. 

In other words, start from the bottom of the competence ladder to avoid making any blunders.
recosjelbhLSfF0u3.Top Body:
**1. Ability**

Remember when we learned about the competence ladder? One of the most common mistakes people make when trying to make changes is overestimating their own ability.

This is known as the **Dunning–Kruger effect**. According to psychologist Dr. David Dunning, the first rule of the Dunning-Kruger club is you don’t know you’re a member of the Dunning-Kruger club.

recp0AYekvC39iKAV.Name: mythBuster 1.2
recp0AYekvC39iKAV.Bottom Body:
**Myth: Dreams are an indicator of sleep quality**

A lot of people believe that if they can't remember their dreams, they didn't sleep well. Likewise, people also believe that remembering a lot of dreams means you slept well. 

**The truth?** Your brain isn't programmed to remember your dreams! Here are a few reasons why:
1. The neurochemical conditions of your brain during sleep means memories don't form in the same way
2. Dreams are weird. It's hard to remember illogical and nonsensical things (epic or emotional dreams sometimes stick better in our memories)
3. A chemical called norepinephrine, which helps move experiences into memory form, is not active during sleep

**In general, people only recall dreams that get interrupted**. If you’re having a restless night, you may remember more dreams than usual.

recp62Qv9kG68f0ES.Name: BasicsQ 1.11
recp62Qv9kG68f0ES.Bottom Body:
\*cue running up the stairs in a silk robe with boxing gloves in the air music\* 

Two questions left!! You can do it! 

The next question is about  "Sleep architecture!" We know you'll get this one right...

recpIFBHLknndVtT1.Name: Quickwin4.2
recpIFBHLknndVtT1.Bottom Body:
Fortunately, there are many ways to boost your melatonin levels the old natural way!

Melatonin is also known as the Dracula hormone because it loves the dark. Too much light exposure before bed can leads to lower levels as you're trying to drift off. 

So, how do you get ready for bed AND boost melatonin?

recpJUJNEwGtB8ptp.Name: Importance 1.5
recpJUJNEwGtB8ptp.Bottom Body:
**Building your sanctuary**
Now that you know how important it is to have a sleep sanctuary _just for sleep_, we’re going to tell you how to build one!

As mentioned, there are infinite ways to level up your sleep sanctuary. We’ll just start with the basics and then you can work on building a next-level sleep sanctuary later.

Even a few little tweaks and changes can improve the quality and quantity of sleep you get every night!

recpM3wN6B5PYw1p0.Name: Sleep Basics 101 Overview 1.5
recpM3wN6B5PYw1p0.Bottom Body:
During the night you move through several stages of sleep that have unique qualities and benefits. This is referred to as **sleep architecture.**

Stages 1 and 2 include lighter sleep.

Stage 3 includes deep restorative sleep. 

REM sleep is primarily when you dream, and you spend more time dreaming in the second half of the night.

recpNNcdMoDh1o7gm.Name: Quiz Set 2.9
recpNNcdMoDh1o7gm.Bottom Body:
Congratulations. 

We can already tell you are on the way to rebooting your mind and you’ve only completed the first week of Reboot Camp!

Can you just imagine how rebooted your mind will be once you’re done week 2 of Reboot Camp?!

You’re doing such a great job, you should be so proud of yourself. Week 1 focused on the most basic of the basics, but week 2 is going to jump in a tiny bit deeper so let’s keep rebooting!

recpnnD5A6uYfa1Zw.Name: Quickwin 1.4
recpnnD5A6uYfa1Zw.Bottom Body:
It's sounds wrong, but it's right!

As your skin is exposed to hot water, it increases blood flow to the surface of the skin. 

This results in heat loss through your skin (especially your hands and feet) and a lowering in your core body temperature. 

Research has found that even just a 10 minute bathing session is enough to gain the sleep-inducing benefits!

recppG54znXAi4D9m.Name: HypeUp 1.7
recppG54znXAi4D9m.Bottom Body:
The most important thing you need to go into this next week of Reboot Camp is just believing that _you can do this!_

Making all of these changes might seem overwhelming, so if that’s the case just keep telling yourself that this is a journey and you are not alone. We are taking this journey with you!

Are you jazzed to dig a little deeper with us? Great! Let’s do it!!

recppsLuoi6Wvjjlj.Name: Decompression 1.3
recppsLuoi6Wvjjlj.Bottom Body:
**Meet the Power Down Hour**
Start thinking of beginning your evening decompression one hour before bedtime.

A **Power Down Hour**, if you will. You can even set an alarm on your phone to cue when to begin!

A power down hour is designed to help your mind unwind from the day, prepare your body for bed, and physically decompress to ease you off to sleep. 

In addition to the mental health benefits, when you do roughly the same routine every night, your brain will associate these activities with bedtime. This triggers your body’s sleep signals.  

To get things started, let's focus on some awesome decompression techniques that you can use in your power down hour...

recq3oAgPev6VxyZj.Name: Quickwin 13.2
recq3oAgPev6VxyZj.Bottom Body:
**Yoga Nidra!**

Not your average yoga, **yoga nidra** is a powerful relaxation technique!

Studies show that Yoga Nidra can successfully help manage mild to severe insomnia and other sleep disorders. 

So, how in the heck do you “yoga nidra”?

recq7cEhiLP59M5Q6.Name: QuickwinFA 14.4
recq7cEhiLP59M5Q6.Bottom Body:
There you have it! Yet another awesome tip to transform you into a master sleeper!

Now let’s recap all of the amazing knowledge you acquired this week.

recqGfPdB2FXP4Cwn.Name: Tracking 1.02
recqGfPdB2FXP4Cwn.Bottom Body:
When it comes to measuring sleep, you should go with the one that appeals to you the most. 

See, we told you that wearables are your friends!

If you want to skip a tracker or monitor –another alternative is a sleep diary. 

Sleep diaries are excellent tools for everyone, we'll learn more about those in the next journey!

recqI3dvesJuTpMWK.Name: Decompression 1.7
recqI3dvesJuTpMWK.Bottom Body:
We don't expect you to build an elaborate bedtime ritual right away. Start with some simple changes this week like journaling or PMR. 

As you get more into your evening ritual, we can continue to build on it and implement more helpful things that can improve the quality of sleep you get every night. 

For now, just focus on making a couple changes at a time.

Each tiny win will lead you on the road to better sleep, trust us!

recqSM3XjWgKVXegz.Name: quickwinFA 5.4
recqSM3XjWgKVXegz.Bottom Body:
Try out this awesome tip this week and see how well it works for you! You can read more about journaling [here](https://intercom.help/rested-health/en/articles/5128187-journal-your-way-to-better-sleep).

When building new habits it’s best to keep them simple and attainable. 

Implement your new habit at least three times this week and take note of how it impacts your sleep. 

You can take actual notes about your sleep in your journal if you want to double-dip on productivity. Stack those habits!

recqWsV0g00iaA4bz.Name: relearn 1.2 copy
recqWsV0g00iaA4bz.Bottom Body:
**1. Only use your bed for sleeping (and sex)**

You’ll see us mention this one again and again. 

IT’S IMPORTANT AND WE WON’T STOP! Sorry for yelling, we got excited. 

**This means that in order to relearn the association between your bed/bedroom + sleep you need to:**
1. Stop watching TV from bed
2. Don’t lay in bed scrolling on your phone
3. Don’t work from bed
4. Don’t make diabolical plans to take over the world from bed
5. Don’t take calls from bed
6. Don’t even read the news in bed
7. Don't eat in bed
8. Is it sleeping or sex (or cuddling)? THEN DON’T DO IT!

recr1IUFPTIxs0PrR.Name: mythBuster 2.1
recr1IUFPTIxs0PrR.Bottom Body:
Here's a myth that we want to bust because it will help you better understand your own sleep needs!

**Myth: More sleep is always better**

A lot of people believe that getting more sleep means you are getting more rest! 

The truth? Our sleep needs vary. In general, quality sleep is better than sleeping for longer periods. There are also genes that impact sleep needs...

recr29K5cjJAK3jgd.Name: Relearn 1.1
recr29K5cjJAK3jgd.Bottom Body:
In order to help reprogram your mind and body for better sleep, you need to reboot the association between bed and sleep.

**A quick review before we get started:**

In your last journey, you discovered that learning by association can lead to many sleep problems.

The two key ways to decondition, or unlearn, an unwanted association is to:

1. **Weaken the association**
2. **Build new associations**

If they no longer occur together, that association begins to weaken. 

**So, how do you get started?**

recr9yyDGoFGaFqyq.Name: Quickwin 6.2
recr9yyDGoFGaFqyq.Bottom Body:
**Blast some upbeat music and bust out some dance moves!**

When you wake up in the morning your body has natural mechanisms that gradually boost your alertness. Getting some activity in your morning ritual is a great way to capitalize on these processes, and doing it in a way that’s fun and brings you joy is going to be the best way to start your day!

**The research**
A 2013 study in the Journal of Positive Psychology showed that 2 weeks of upbeat music significantly boosted people's moods and happiness levels!

recrAfTUDZTJJw2pv.Name: Rebootwelcome 1.0
recrAfTUDZTJJw2pv.Bottom Body:
You've worked so hard.

You've come so far. 

And now it's finally time to begin Reboot Camp!

Remember to keep an open mind, do things at your own pace, and maybe even have a little fun. 

Let's get Rebooted!

recrGOihwKBy6nPsJ.Name: Quickwin 9.1
recrGOihwKBy6nPsJ.Bottom Body:
Are you ready for your next Quick Win?

Today we’re going to talk about a little habit that can literally change your brain. 

The benefits include:
- Improved self-esteem
- Increased ability to handle stress
- Goal-boosting 

All of these cool benefits and it only takes a couple of minutes a day.

What is it?

recrPApeSH9KYXDAe.Name: Tracking 2.1
recrPApeSH9KYXDAe.Bottom Body:
Whether or not you use a wearable to track your sleep, you may also find a sleep diary helpful. If you’ve ever seen a sleep therapist, you already know all about sleep diaries. 

**Why use a sleep diary?**
A sleep diary is helpful because it captures things that a wearable can’t. For instance, your wearable can’t track your emotions, what you ate, or how you feel about not being invited to Laura’s wedding. 

**Where do I find a sleep diary?**
You can get a sleep diary app, download a template online, or simply make notes in your very own journal. Use whatever format you enjoy the most.

We'll give you some general guidelines on how to make a diary. You don't have to keep one forever, just while you're working on fixing up your sleep!
recrPApeSH9KYXDAe.Top Body: ## How to make a sleep diary

recrSXK7qwKg5vmoY.Name: Quickwin 10.1
recrSXK7qwKg5vmoY.Bottom Body:
Are you ready for a bedtime quick win?

This one will be sure to help your sleep in a number of ways.

It’s common to have disruptions during the night and sometimes it’s hard as heck to fall back asleep.

Want to learn the quick win we have to deal with this?

recrSelQNKikmw6wD.Name: Quickwin 9.4
recrSelQNKikmw6wD.Bottom Body:
**Positive Affirmations for Sleep**

“I release today”

“I let go of today’s anxiety and stress”

“I am safe, I am fulfilled, I am at peace”

“I sleep peacefully knowing that I’ve done all I could for today”

“My muscles are relaxed, my mind is at peace, I am ready for sleep”

recrTLMr4kBNYTNd3.Name: Quickwin 7.3
recrTLMr4kBNYTNd3.Bottom Body:
The most popular (and easiest way) is to take a cold shower. The benefits of cold therapy come from water that’s around 9°F (15°C). 

You can start with a warm shower, gradually make it cold, then have another shot of warmth before you leave!

If you’re feeling extreme, you can go ahead and use ice baths. This method is especially helpful if you’re combating muscle soreness. Just be sure you take a warm shower or bath afterward. 

Do your session at least an hour before bed and don’t be afraid to ease yourself into the process, it’s not always easy being cold.

recrhOMRA8pEYhKwH.Name: sneaky 1.7
recrhOMRA8pEYhKwH.Bottom Body:
**Allergy (and flu) medications and sleep**

Sometimes you need to take a certain allergy or flu medication and its sleep-disrupting problems are the least of your concerns. 

However, knowing how to select medications that have a minimal impact on your sleep is important!

**Stimulants**
Many over-the-counter medications contain **Pseudoephedrine**. This decongestant can lead to sleeplessness and lowered sleep quality. It's fine from time to time but try to limit your use before bed if possible. 

**First-generation**
There are also many first-generation allergy medications that may lead to excessive drowsiness that lingers long after you've woken up. They can also disrupt the quality of your sleep and reduce REM.

These include d**iphenhydramine, chlorpheniramine, brompheniramine,** and **doxylamine.**

**TIPS**:
- Limit your use of sleep-disrupting medications to 7 days
- Swap out your allergy meds for ones that are less disruptive to slumber such as **loratadine.**
- Use saline sprays or a neti pot to help with allergies

\*Always talk to your doctor before discontinuing or changing your medications

recrmwHq8LofmevBt.Name: Bedroom 1.1
recrmwHq8LofmevBt.Bottom Body:
**Your bedroom**
Take a moment to think about your bedroom. Think about some words you’d use to describe it. 

Is sleep sanctuary among those words? It should be!

**The facts**
You spend a third of your life sleeping. That’s over 200 hours a month and over 3,000 hours a year. That’s a lot!

One of the most common mistakes that people make is not investing effort into making their room conducive to sleep. 

We’re going to show you how to avoid that mistake with a few little tips.

recrq6tAk6KWQ2EDv.Name: Food 1.1
recrq6tAk6KWQ2EDv.Bottom Body:
Are you ready to jump into the next Reboot Camp topic!?

It’s all about FOOD, and who doesn’t love to talk about food?

**Food and sleep**

Food is important (and delicious). Believe it or not, food can have a pretty big impact on your sleep!

Certain foods can act sort of like potholes on your road to slumberville.

We’re going to give you some basic info on how to not let your tasty snacks mess with your sleep!

recs23DIvDBfyUXUb.Name: Oriented 1.5
recs23DIvDBfyUXUb.Bottom Body:
## 3. Your Sleep Coach 
Your sleep coach is always available to answer your burning questions about sleep. Simply send them a message and you'll receive your reply within a few hours. 

Sleep coaches are professionally trained sleep experts who have a passion for helping you sleep better! 

You'll even be given opportunities to have one-on-one sessions with your sleep coach!  _Sweeeeeet_.

recsB0A2AK3zMJEV8.Name: quickwinFA 3.3
recsB0A2AK3zMJEV8.Bottom Body:
Want to start meditating? Add 10 minutes of meditation time right after you brush your teeth in the morning. 

Want to stretch more? Do a stretching routine during your favorite show!

See? Scheduling a new habit alongside one that's already well-established sets you up for success and takes out a lot of the hassle. 

It's all about working smarter!

recsa6SVmJJ8zOUIk.Name: Trackingprogress 1.1
recsa6SVmJJ8zOUIk.Bottom Body:
You may be wondering:
**How do I track my progress?**

Tracking your sleep can be tricky. The number one way to track your sleep is with a sleep diary. 

A sleep diary is simply a log of when you went to bed, when you woke up, and some other details about your day and night. 

Tracking your sleep will help you identify habits that may be messing with your sleep and will also let you know over time how some new habits may be having a positive impact on your sleep!

recsb5ZpvwcjHrdhY.Name: HypeUp 1.3
recsb5ZpvwcjHrdhY.Bottom Body:
We also reviewed how activities in your morning, daytime, and night can impact your sleep.

**Morning:** Wake up at the same time every morning, grab a glass of water, and get moving!

**Daytime:** Daily exercise for just 20 minutes improves the quality of your sleep

**Night:** A power-down hour where you mentally decompress and put away electronics can be a game-changer for your sleep!

recshs8FFfS1XpNsC.Name: Grogginess 1.4
recshs8FFfS1XpNsC.Bottom Body:
Wouldn’t it be great if we had some tips on what you can do to beat the grogginess?

Oh, that’s right! We DO have some tips for you to beat that groggy monster. We told you we’d always have your back, and we weren’t lying homey!

Let’s start with the first tip!

recsodmLQm3be39xa.Name: Sleepdrive 1.6
recsodmLQm3be39xa.Bottom Body:
So, to recap – Your circadian alerting system goes off the clock at the end of the day so your sleep drive can send you to snoozeville.

Your circadian rhythm keeps the alerting system quiet during the night and sends all those good sleep chemicals your way so you can maintain your snoozefest!  

Rinse and repeat.

recstsfjpqnlVSAWm.Name: habittips 1.2
recstsfjpqnlVSAWm.Bottom Body:
**2. STACK IT**

Habit stacking is an awesome technique that eases the burden of starting something new. If you want to start a new habit or behavior, add it on to an existing habit or behavior. 

**How to habit stack**
For instance, want to kickstart your mornings with a made bed? As soon as you get out of bed in the morning, make your bed! You can also add things like meditation to morning coffee, or stretching right after you brush your teeth. 

Think of habit stacking as your built-in scheduling system for new habits

recszTufkAzvlVQ3e.Name: sneaky 1.5
recszTufkAzvlVQ3e.Bottom Body:
**Alcohol and sleep**
You may or may not be aware that alcohol is commonly used as a sleep aid, commonly referred to as a “nightcap".

This is because it causes a sedative effect by mimicking an important chemical messenger in your brain, called GABA. 

So, a little booze in the evening may feel like it’s helping you fall asleep, but in actuality, it is secretly wreaking havoc on your peaceful slumber. 

**Your sleep on alcohol**
- Alcohol reduces REM sleep
- It sends excitatory signals as it's metabolized
- Booze reduces sleep quality
- Makes snoring and sleep apnea worse

**TIPS:**
- Avoid drinking within 3 hours of bedtime
- Stay hydrated to help your body metabolize alcohol
- Swap out for a non-alcoholic beer in the evenings (the hops can help you sleep)

rect4MZBsRgFLOsJa.Name: Lighting 1.3
rect4MZBsRgFLOsJa.Bottom Body:
**Motion sensor night lights!**

You should use night lights with motion sensors to help guide you during bathroom breaks or any other disruptions. 

By relying on this type of night light, you avoid having to turn on overhead lights in the middle of the night, which can mess with your melatonin production and make it harder for you to fall back asleep.

If the lights only turn on when you’re already awake, there’s less of a chance that they can’t mess with you while you’re sleeping, too!

They’ll also help save your toes from injuries when attempting to navigate in the dark.

rect4lDSXj0aBspyQ.Name: quickwin 3.3
rect4lDSXj0aBspyQ.Bottom Body:
Want to start meditating? Add 10 minutes of meditation time right after you brush your teeth in the morning. 

Want to stretch more? Do a stretching routine during your favorite show!

See? Scheduling a new habit alongside one that's already well-established sets you up for success and takes out a lot of the hassle. 

It's all about working smarter!

rect8PB4pUAJCPvsJ.Name: Substances 1.7
rect8PB4pUAJCPvsJ.Bottom Body:
**Alcohol pumps you up!** 

When you first drink that nightcap it leads to a relaxing sedative effect. However, as your body metabolizes alcohol in the wee hours of the morning, it blasts excitatory chemicals. 

Excitatory chemicals aren’t exactly helpful for sleep. 

**Alcohol disrupts your sleep cycles!** 
Alcohol can help you slip into deep sleep more quickly but it is disruptive to your sleep architecture.

Alcohol leads to a reduction in REM sleep. REM sleep is when you mostly dream and is extremely important for mental restoration, memory reconsolidation, and emotional processing!

**Alcohol makes you a bad bed partner!**
Alcohol can also make snoring and sleep apnea worse.  It’s also a diuretic, which means more bathroom breaks. Aside from disrupting your own sleep, these qualities make you less fun to share a bed with!

rectIVajhyKG50VoN.Name: Quickwin 14.3
rectIVajhyKG50VoN.Bottom Body:
**Setting your bedtime: The Dr. Breus method.**

**Step #1**: Set your wake time
**Step #2**: Work backwards from your chosen wake time. 
**Step #3**: Assume you’ll have 5 sleep cycles, consisting of approximately 90 minutes each (90x5 = 450 minutes)
**Step #4**: Subtract 450 minutes from your chosen wake time (or 7.5 hours)
**Step #5**: Give yourself 20 minutes to fall asleep.

And Voila! You have your bedtime set.

Need an example?

Ok so if you want to wake up at 7am: 
1. 7am - 7.5 hours = 11:30pm
2. 11:30pm - 20 minutes to fall asleep = 11:10 bedtime!

Easy peasy!

Try this out for yourself as a way to get your “ideal” schedule on. It may take some adjusting. When things are well aligned, you’ll find yourself waking up 5 to 10 minutes before your alarm clock.

rectLGbm47q6xQ3VH.Name: quickwins 3.2
rectLGbm47q6xQ3VH.Bottom Body:
**Habit-Stacking**

You may or may not have heard of habit-stacking. Either way, it's important to understand how you can use this concept to help you build new habits around sleep!

**What is habit-stacking**
Building new habits is hard and mentally taxing. One excellent technique that makes building new habits WAY easier is habit-stacking. 

You take your new habit that you want to build and you combine it with a habit you already have! For instance, if you want to add journaling to your day – combine journaling with your morning cup of coffee.

rectiZYXUGpB3ZeGc.Name: Grogginess 1.5
rectiZYXUGpB3ZeGc.Bottom Body:
**Try a Green Smoothie! Nom nom nom.**

Not only are green smoothies DELICIOUS, but they can help boost focus and reduce inflammation. Inflammation causes a lot more “feeling bleh” than you realize.

You can find a plethora of green smoothie recipes online, but we have a super quick and simple recipe to share with you right now that you can try:

Rested Health Green Smoothie
- 1 handful of kale
- 1 handful of parsley
- 1 cup of mixed fruit
- 1 Tbsp flax seeds
- 3/4 Cup green tea - (cooled) or tsp Matcha
- 1 Tbsp hemp seeds

Drinking one of these everyday can seriously improve your energy levels! You can even swap it out for your usual morning coffee!

Don’t go anywhere just yet, we have another tip for you...

rectkFCj37nM2QTHA.Name: unlearn 1.3
rectkFCj37nM2QTHA.Bottom Body:
**Learning by association**
When you engage in activities in bed that aren't sleeping, your brain creates associations between those activities and sleep!

Sleep therapists call this **stimulus dyscontrol**.

Let's learn by emoji for a moment...

**Stimulus control**
🛏 + 💤 = Good stimulus control
🛏 +💻+📺+📱+🍔 = Stimulus dyscontrol

**Ok, Give me an example!**
Sure! Let's look at watching TV in bed as an example of a stimulus. If you regularly watch TV in bed, your mind associates bed with TV. 

Laying in bed will then activate pathways in your brain that say "hey, put on our show, we're ready to be entertained!"

Ideally, when you lay in bed, the only pathway you want to be activated are the ones that say "Zzzzzzzzzzzz."

**Practice makes ummm ....imperfect**
The more things you do in bed, the more of these unhelpful programs that get formed.

The more frequently you do that activity in bed, the stronger (and more powerful) those pathways become.

Good stimulus control is very simple: Bed + Sleep (and sex). We like simple. So do your body's internal clocks.

rectvkJQzmqJaGMRA.Name: Electronics 1.2
rectvkJQzmqJaGMRA.Bottom Body:
Do you find yourself lying in bed feeling wide awake at night?

Does your mind conjure up an endless list of thoughts when your head hits the pillow and you just can’t seem to shut it off?

If you’re spending a lot of time on your electronics before bedtime, this may be a reason you have trouble unwinding at the end of the day. 

Let’s find out why...

recuDF6KPjTbllh7C.Name: Quickwin 10.1
recuDF6KPjTbllh7C.Bottom Body:
It’s that time again! Time for another Quick Win!

This next one can help to boost your sleep-wake cycle, and can even help to sync a circadian rhythm that might be thrown off track!

Let’s find out what it is...

recuIqZbs0G5UFjXM.Name: Elimhabits 1.1
recuIqZbs0G5UFjXM.Bottom Body:
We want to help you reach your goal of reducing electronics before bed. 

**Defining your goal**
As you now know, using electronics before bed can disrupt your sleep in a number of ways. For instance, the blue light emitted from electronics reduces melatonin two times longer than other types of light.

To get you started, we're going to talk about two things you can do to help you reduce electronics before bed!

1. Get alarmed 
2. Swap it out

recuQgqMU3mwwiFVG.Name: goalsleepthrunight1.2
recuQgqMU3mwwiFVG.Bottom Body:
**1. Mental decompression routine**

Not properly decompressing before bed can lead to midnight awakenings and reduced sleep quality.

**Why?** When you fall asleep with lingering "to-do" lists and hovering worries, your mind keeps working on these problems as you try to sleep. Remember subconscious sleep stress? It's real, and it will quite literally haunt your dreams!

**How do I decompress?** You should aim to wind down from your day about an hour before you usually go to sleep. One of the most effective techniques you can try is journaling! 

Try making a to-do list for tomorrow with an action plan for any items that are up in the air. This allows your brain to have closure from your day.

recuSK072WWvJXC8n.Name: HypeUp 1.5
recuSK072WWvJXC8n.Bottom Body:
Don’t forget that change takes time so be patient with your journey and GET PUMPED UP to learn so much more about how to reboot your sleep system.

This week, we’re going to dig a little deeper into the techniques you can use to start sleeping better or how to improve the techniques you’re currently using!

recuaFfU0gnEhqAQa.Name: Why  1.2
recuaFfU0gnEhqAQa.Bottom Body:
**YES! REALLY!**
Sleep is an essential need, but there is zero evidence that you can actually die from lack of sleep. 

**For real?**
Yeah! In fact, the Guinness Book of World Records even used to hold world records for wakefulness (a terrible idea which they eventually suspended). 

As an example: In 1977, Mrs. Maureen Weston of Peterborough, Cambridgeshire stayed awake for 449 hours. Yeesh, Mrs. Weston, take a nap. 

Sure, she wasn't exactly thriving by the end, and she began to hallucinate a little. BUT, she was alive and fully recovered once she allowed slumber back into her life. 

**How did she survive?**

recutmYSgY5kpCuUv.Name: Importance 1.2
recutmYSgY5kpCuUv.Bottom Body:
**Why is a sleep sanctuary important?** 

Creating an environment that’s relaxing and inviting can actually help your sleep. 

An inviting and peaceful environment helps to create helpful associations between bedroom + sleep. 

You can get incredibly advanced with building a state-of-the-art sleep sanctuary.

For now, let’s check out the basics!

recvH4R2D6Vp9cae3.Name: Supplements 1.5
recvH4R2D6Vp9cae3.Bottom Body:
You’ve got the basics down, so here is one more sleep supplement that may surprise you:

Hops! Hops has long been used as a sleep aid and works extremely well when combined with valerian root. Hops has natural sedative effects and lowers your core temperature, which helps you fall asleep. 

Try 300 to 500mg on its own or 40-60mg when combined with 300 mg of valerian root.
 
If you like beer at night, switch to a **non-alcoholic beer** to get your hops on without disrupting your sleep! Studies have even shown that a non-alcoholic beer with dinner can improve sleep that evening!

recvIrz1TljrKtKYN.Name: habittips 1.1
recvIrz1TljrKtKYN.Bottom Body:
As you go about setting small achievable goals each week, it helps to have some pro tips in your back pocket. 

The first tip is:
**1. START SMALL**
Trying to make a change? Start small. Make it something so achievable that your success rate is 100%. For instance, if you're trying to start meditating, do it for 1 minute. That's it! 

The important thing is to get started and earn a win. This creates momentum, moves you closer to your goal, and gives you the confidence boost of that "ok, I **can** do this" feeling.

recvJayBxKQjCu3nk.Name: Importance 1.6
recvJayBxKQjCu3nk.Bottom Body:
Are you ready?

Great! Let’s explore the basics of an awesome sleep sanctuary!

TIP: As you begin making changes to your room, feel free to refer to it as your sleep sanctuary. There’s no scientific reason, it just sounds cool.

Let’s go!

recvNzRVcBT1c2Fuw.Name: Exercise 1.4
recvNzRVcBT1c2Fuw.Bottom Body:
When you exercise during the day this is a good thing for your circadian rhythm because as your body cools down it can help trigger evening sleepiness. 

**How to exercise your way to better sleep**

If you currently aren’t exercising, any exercise that you enjoy is a great start. You should aim for around 20 minutes a day.

There are three general categories of exercise that promote better sleep:
1. Aerobic exercise (aim for 80% max heart rate)
2. Strength training (pump the iron)
3. Flexibility training (yoga, pilates, etc)

recvOyZE1Rcy435zq.Name: BasicsQ 1.3
recvOyZE1Rcy435zq.Bottom Body:
Now, let's take a moment to remember everything you learned about "Don't worry, your body will sleep."

You do remember absolutely everything, right? 

Let's take the quiz...

recvQ1f9F5N7SzdWH.Name: Needs 1.1
recvQ1f9F5N7SzdWH.Bottom Body:
In the last journey, we asked you how much sleep you think you need.

**Want to know the truth?** The official recommendation for adults of all ages is somewhere between 7-8 hours per night. 

Some people need a little less. Some people need a little more. 

You will also find that your body needs more or less depending on your activities that day! 

Later on, we'll teach you how to find the optimal amount of sleep for **you**.

recvYn9PiWYFE1pUr.Name: Mornings 1.6
recvYn9PiWYFE1pUr.Bottom Body:
**Treat yourself to some sunshine!**

Are you aware that getting even 10 minutes of sun exposure early in the morning can help you sleep better at night!?

Getting doses of sun exposure boosts your natural “wake up” hormones and helps regulate your circadian rhythm, which keeps your brain, body, and sleep cycle healthy! Win, win, win!

As a bonus, you’ll also get a little mood boost from serotonin. Your body loves a little sunshine. 

Try doubling up on benefits by pairing sun exposure with some fresh morning air! Fresh air is known to reduce stress and improve sleep.

recvaezokp2rNRDhH.Name: Food 1.3
recvaezokp2rNRDhH.Bottom Body:
**Sugar vs other sugar vs a different sugar**

Not all sugar is equal when it comes to impacting sleep. The worst offenders are added refined sugars and syrups like you find in sugary drinks, candy, chocolates, deserts, cakes, and cookies. 

Fruits are often high in sugar but do not appear to have the same detrimental impact on sleep. So, if you’re having a sweet craving before sleep, grab a banana or some mango! 

Controlling your sugar intake is a great plan for health and better sleep. 

However, sugar isn’t the only food that impacts your snoozing...

recvbYc7YwWs2MKrH.Name: Science 1.5
recvbYc7YwWs2MKrH.Bottom Body:
Sleep might seem complicated, but some of the solutions to better sleep are actually pretty simple. There are a lot of different things you can do to optimize your sleep. 

But first, let’s learn a little bit more about how to track your sleep.

recvcYISuPYR4QMLb.Name: QuickwinFA 7.2
recvcYISuPYR4QMLb.Bottom Body:
**Sauna Time!**

Regular Sauna use has been shown to have a plethora of health benefits. It can improve how well you sleep, boost heart health, and research shows it can even reduce risk of dementia!

Some of the sleep benefits to sauna use are believed to be a product of the increased temperature at the surface of your skin (which cools your core temperature for bed) and increased heart rate.

Think of it like cardio without the ummm...cardio. 

In general, regular sauna sessions improve continuity of sleep and can **help you fall asleep faster.**

recvjyeU4mYUyh7Wv.Name: goals pre quiz
recvjyeU4mYUyh7Wv.Bottom Body:
Now that you've got building goals down, let's get started on some tips made just for you! 

We want to help you build your own SMART goals by giving you personalized and actionable advice based on your needs. 

To kick things off, let's look at the number one thing you'd like to focus on this week...

recvzAJ4E92c1q9Xp.Name: Tracking 1.5
recvzAJ4E92c1q9Xp.Bottom Body:
The data from your tracker gets analyzed and put into graphs that help you get an idea of your sleep.

Here’s what they offer:

- **Sleep/Wake Times**: Gathered using measurements of movement and heart rate and sometimes even breathing patterns. 

- **Sleep Duration**: Measure sleep time and awakenings during the night to calculate total sleep duration. 

- **Sleep Quality**: Devices use metrics such as heart rate, movement, and even brain waves to assess sleep quality. Some apps even plot out sleep stages and cycles per night. 

**NOTE**: Unless you're wearing a tracker that measures brain waves, the measures of sleep stages aren't too accurate. However, they can give you a general idea of your sleeping patterns!

recw1eIVdtNYiD4TH.Name: general 1.1
recw1eIVdtNYiD4TH.Bottom Body:
A little stress is ok, but when stress feels out of control it can be very detrimental to your health. 

Fortunately, there are many ways that you can control your stress for better sleep. 

In order to better manage your stress, there are two areas we'll focus on today:
1. **Mental decompression routine**
2. **Managing stress in the moment**

recw5Wyi5DIgwOnse.Name: Sleepdrive 1.7
recw5Wyi5DIgwOnse.Bottom Body:
Now you know how your sleep drive works directly with your circadian rhythm to promote the healthiest sleep-wake cycle. 

To end off, here are a few tips you can use to help boost your sleep drive:

1. **Try waking up at the same time every day**
2. **Go easy on the caffeine** - caffeine blocks adenosine
3. **Avoid daytime naps** - they relieve your sleep pressure prematurely

Learning how these processes work and making adjustments to your routine isn’t going to be easy, we know. 

Try focusing on just one change at a time and remember we’ll be right here cheering you on!

recw5tGHNt2x3aIg8.Name: Quickwin 10.2
recw5tGHNt2x3aIg8.Bottom Body:
**Pack your nightstand.**

You can stock your nightstand with supplies that you can use in case you have trouble getting back into la-la land.
 
- **Earplugs:** It might get noisy sometimes, silence is conducive to sleep. Noise in the middle of the night can be especially irritating, so let those earplugs mute the disruptions. 

- **Eye mask:** Unexpected awakenings can lead to unintended light exposure. By blocking light from hitting your eyes your body responds with more melatonin. Melatonin = sleep. 

- **Headphones**: Sometimes we need a little extra help falling back to sleep. If you share a bed with someone you may need to keep things quiet so keeping headphones nearby means you can listen to relaxing meditation tracks, nature sounds, or soothing music to help you fall back to sleep any time. 

- **Book and a booklight**: Reading is an excellent relaxing activity if your mind is having a hard time settling. Keeping a book and booklight in your supply drawer is an excellent strategy for when you need to lull yourself back toward sleep.

recwCGqKj51nBViMm.Name: Quickwin 7.4
recwCGqKj51nBViMm.Bottom Body:
Breathing techniques are fantastic skills to have in your little toolbox. 

Being able to send your body into a calmer state will also allow you to think more clearly and feel more in control. 

Remember that it may be difficult at first, that's normal. Practicing breathing techniques will make you more efficient at breathing! 

OK, now back to the journey!

recwHDYLSH0Mjc457.Name: Overview 1.6
recwHDYLSH0Mjc457.Bottom Body:
Most importantly, don’t forget that change takes time. Even if you implemented all of these changes tonight, it would still take some time to see the effects.

Be patient with yourself, have fun with the changes, and get excited to start feeling more Rested!

Now, are you ready to put all this knowledge to the test?

recwIDsOrLUMW23zn.Name: Electronics 1.1
recwIDsOrLUMW23zn.Bottom Body:
**How your nighttime activities impact your sleep!**

To kick things off, we're going to focus on one of the most common and problematic nighttime activities.

Can you guess what it is? (It was written on the card, so your chances of being right are pretty high)

recwK1RlG1pjz1etY.Name: unlearn 1.5
recwK1RlG1pjz1etY.Bottom Body:
**Reprogramming for better sleep**
Just like how repetition helped you learn the association, repetition will also help you unlearn it (it just takes a little longer to do the unlearning part).

The two key ways to decondition, or unlearn, an unwanted association is to:

1. **Weaken the association**
2. **Build new associations**

If they no longer occur together, that association begins to weaken. 

**Out with the old, in with the new!**
Even better, is that by learning new associations (a.k.a. good habits), you can stomp that weakened association even harder into the ground. Unlearn and relearn.  

These concepts apply to pretty much every learned habit and response. 

It also explains why that song that made you cry in 7th grade because it reminded you of your ex doesn’t quite hit the same anymore.  

**So now what?**

recwPvBnotDjN112K.Name: Quickwin 9.4
recwPvBnotDjN112K.Bottom Body:

recwiTzPZmlEEEyhP.Name: Food 1.7
recwiTzPZmlEEEyhP.Bottom Body:
But what if you’re reeeeeeally hungry before bed?

Wait! Before you reach for that bedtime snack...are you actually reeeeeally hungry or are you just craving a snack?

The best way to answer that question is to think of something less appealing to eat. Ask yourself “will this less appealing food hit the spot?” and if you answer no, you’re probably not that hungry.

If you answer yes, maybe you do need a little bedtime snack. We don’t want you going to bed hungry, which is also not good for your sleep.

recwkXLvaHRhUjchQ.Name: goalfallasleepfaster1.3
recwkXLvaHRhUjchQ.Bottom Body:
**2. Only go to bed when you are tired**

Imagine this... It's 11:30pm, you know you have to get up at 6am, you know you won't feel Rested if you don't get 7 hours of sleep.
BUT
You aren't tired. You feel fatigued, but not sleepy. 

You go to bed anyways, because that's what we do when the time comes. You lay in bed, feeling awake, trying to will sleep to happen, and...

nothing. 

You stay there a while, thinking about how tired you're going to be. You feel the stress build, the existential dread, the frustration.

Sleep isn't coming.

You don't have to conquer everything at once. The important thing is to focus on making some progress. Even just 1% of change per day will bring you closer to your goals!

Don't worry – we'll help you pick some specific habits to work on to help you reach your current top sleep goal!

**Get started**
Start out by eliminating one unhelpful activity three nights this week. You don't have to change everything overnight! It's all about progress, not perfection.

recxjHc2U5g0M0ONZ.Name: Food 1.5
recxjHc2U5g0M0ONZ.Bottom Body:
**Spicy food and sleep**

Spicy foods close to bedtime can cause heartburn, acid reflux, and in more severe cases gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).

This makes sleeping more difficult because the symptoms get worse when you lie down. (Of course they do…)

So, avoid any spicy food for at least 3 hours before bedtime. We wouldn’t ask you to cut it out, because...yum. 

**Now that you know how foods impact your sleep, let’s look at how to sleep better while still enjoying your treats!**

recy1r8hCmtSDS2eS.Name: general 1.2
recy1r8hCmtSDS2eS.Bottom Body:
**1. Mental decompression routine**

Mental decompression is an essential need if you want to live a better life. You can choose a number of ways to decompress – exercise, yoga, meditation, journaling, and more. It's important to choose something you enjoy doing. 

**When to decompress**
You can use mental decompression techniques any time of day, but they are especially effective at the end of the day. That's when your mind is tired and the stress of the day is sitting on your shoulders. 

We suggest that you take 10 to 20 minutes before your bedtime to wind down from your day.

You can choose whatever technique you like, today we'll talk to you about one powerful (and fun) technique...

recy8XDWyFTizZpqI.Name: goalsleepschedule1.2
recy8XDWyFTizZpqI.Top Body:
**1. Get alarmed**  

Alarms aren't just for mornings anymore. In order to help you stay regimented, set an alarm for your evening winddown hour. Many smartphones have this feature built-in!

When your evening alarm goes off, it's time to drop all activities and begin your bedtime routine. Try some meditation, journaling, and a relaxing skincare regimen. 

**As for morning?** Put your alarm away from your bed so you can't reach snooze. It's simple, but it works!

We’ll focus on important aspects of your life that significantly affect sleep and how to level up. 

We’re also going to introduce you to the best ways to track and measure your sleep using wearables or a sleep diary! This will help you build that accountability muscle. 

We’ll also give you more tips on how to strengthen your relationship between your bedroom + sleep. It’s gonna be a fun time!

By learning how to optimize your sleep, you can improve your sleep architecture and gain incredible sleep benefits.

**How to do positive affirmations for sleep**
Once you’ve completed your bedtime routine and cozied up in bed, try doing positive affirmations before you intend to drift off.

Choose one affirmation that resonates with you and repeat it 10 times. You can keep track by dropping fingers as you say them. 

Don’t rush through them, say them with intention and try to really believe the words. You can say them out loud or in your head. 

**Let’s take a look at some sample affirmations for sleep...**

recypqte9aJCEtDjP.Name: Supplements 1.3
recypqte9aJCEtDjP.Bottom Body:
**The basic sleep supplements**

These supplements cover the common vitamin or mineral deficiencies associated with sleep problems:

- **Vitamin D:** Vitamin D deficiency can seriously interrupt sleep and **over 40% of us are deficient in the sunshine vitamin**. Getting 600 to 800 IU daily can help with that.

- **Multivitamin:** A daily multivitamin covers your recommended intake for a variety of vitamins and minerals that can help sleep. 

- **Iron:** Iron deficiency can be disruptive to sleep and increase anxiety and restless leg syndrome. Have your levels checked and supplement as needed to improve your sleep. 

- **Magnesium:** Low magnesium can result in insomnia, restless sleep, frequent waking, and anxiety. **Around 50% of people don’t get enough magnesium**. Try taking 500 to 800 mg daily of magnesium glycinate

recyu3kvczZCXwOI0.Name: Sleepdrive 1.2
recyu3kvczZCXwOI0.Bottom Body:
Adenosine is an **inhibitory neurotransmitter.**

**A what, now?** It basically just means that this brain chemical is responsible for **slowing things down.**

The more adenosine, the sleepier you will feel. 

After 12-16 hours of being awake, adenosine levels peak and you might start to notice the sleepy effects, such as finding yourself yawning a lot and maybe even starting to nod off if you’ve really built up a lot of sleep pressure.

Adenosine will continue to accumulate until you succumb to sleep, where it will then become cleared from your body and the process will start all over again the next day!

recywuagiZ6wLWkrh.Name: BedtimeBasics 1.3
recywuagiZ6wLWkrh.Bottom Body:
**Choosing sheets**

The first rule of bedsheets is: **Higher thread count doesn’t mean higher quality. **

**Wait, what?**

Here’s the truth – thread counts above 500 often lead to changes in fibers that resemble synthetic fibers. This means that the natural qualities of the fibers get lost in production. 

While it may feel silky smooth, high thread count sheets may also hold moisture and be less helpful for temperature control.

Nobody enjoys night sweats. 

So, save yourself some money and stick with natural fabrics! You’ll gain the benefits of temperature control and moisture-wicking. You can use that extra money you saved to buy a silk pillowcase or a nice eye mask. 

**Let’s look at how to pick your natural sheets...**

recz6LsPucQkWnX8s.Name: spower 1.7
recz6LsPucQkWnX8s.Bottom Body:
**Your body on sleep**
Sleep improves every area of functioning in your body.

**Sleep:**
- Boosts immune functioning
- Improves heart and vascular health
- Reduces pain and inflammation
- Boosts metabolism and regulates hunger (lack of sleep makes your hunger hormones soar)
- Improves your skin and aids in muscle repair
- Increases your lifespan

There's a reason you feel like a million bucks after a good night of sleep. We'll explore more the specific mechanisms of how quality sleep boosts your health later.

For now, just know that when we say that sleep is your superpower – we mean it!

reczQgPXTzmemhbGo.Name: Importance 1.4
reczQgPXTzmemhbGo.Bottom Body:
**Space concerns**
Not everyone can restrict their bedrooms to just sleep. You may have a studio apartment, a bedroom office, or some other constraint that limits you from banning all non-sleep activities. 

**Good news!** 
Your Rested Health sleep pals to the rescue! We have tips and tricks for any problem that comes your way!

In the case of limited space in your living area, we have a couple of suggestions to separate life from bed:
- Stop activity a few hours before bedtime
- Change your environment at bedtime, such as covering screens with blankets (this creates a cue for your brain that the activity has ended)

reczVfrAJuCYC7ffd.Bottom Body:
You may be wondering _“if sleep pressure increases all day, why don’t I feel tired all day long?_” and yes, we have the answer for that too!

Remember everything you learned about your circadian rhythm? Great! That info comes in real handy here.

Sleep relies on a two-process model. Your sleep drive is one process and your circadian rhythm is the other (like a dynamic duo of sleep!)

One of the functions of your circadian rhythm is your _circadian alerting system._

But why? Your body sleeps better when it's cool. Believe it or not, a warm shower or bath actually cools your core temperature, making ideal conditions for sleep!
